0.title: Sharad Pawar first to use the word 'Hindu terror': Devendra Fadnavis
0.article_body: Maharashtra ex-CM Devendra Fadnavis criticised NCP chief Sharad Pawar and said that his party has an old track record of "appeasement politics and polarising the society on communal basis". He further said that Pawar was the first person to use the word "Hindu terror". The NCP has grand plans on bringing a Muslim quota in Maharashtra, the BJP leader added.

1.title: 25-yr-old man murders lover over suspicion of an affair in Gujarat; held
1.article_body: A 25-year-old man was arrested in Gujarat's Chhotaudepur for allegedly murdering his 23-year-old girlfriend over suspicion of an affair. The accused, Karshan Rathwa had picked up the woman on his bike on Tuesday. "When she received a call...from another man...he (Rathwa) questioned her about the affair. They had a fight and he strangulated her on the spot," police said.

2.title: HC awards ₹2.5 cr compensation to family of accident victim who died
2.article_body: Bombay High Court awarded ₹2.5 crore as compensation to family of an accident victim who died in 2011. The family had challenged an earlier order of giving them ₹1.03 crore as compensation and sought an enhancement of the amount. HC directed a tempo driver, involved in the accident, and an insurance company to pay the rest amount within a month.

3.title: Protesting farmers in H'yana file 'missing' complaint of local MP
3.article_body: Farmers, who've been holding a protest seeking compensation for their damaged crops for a month in Haryana's Hisar, have filed a "missing" complaint of the local BJP MP Brijendra Singh with police. A Samyukt Kisan Morcha (SKM) leader claimed that "the public is searching for Singh as development projects are halted". A police spokesperson confirmed that the complaint was filed.

4.title: There's something that RR have seen in Parag, which we haven't in last 3 years: Manjrekar
4.article_body: Talking about RR's 20-year-old all-rounder Riyan Parag, Sanjay Manjrekar said, "There's something that RR have seen in him, which we haven't seen in last three years." Manjrekar stated, "In his two full IPL seasons...he averaged about 11. His strike rate was around 110. They went for him in auction and bought him at a much higher price of ₹3.8 crore."

5.title: Saudi prince, a major Twitter shareholder, rejects Musk's offer; he replies
5.article_body: Saudi Prince Alwaleed bin Talal Al Saud, a billionaire and one of Twitter's largest shareholders, rejected Tesla CEO Elon Musk's offer to acquire Twitter saying his offer isn't close to the company's "intrinsic value". Meanwhile, Musk replied, "Just two questions...How much of Twitter does the Kingdom own, directly & indirectly? What are the Kingdom's views on journalistic freedom of speech?"

6.title: 2 women caught while taking lift from contractor they earlier robbed in G'gram
6.article_body: Two women were arrested in Gurugram after they took a lift from a contractor, four months after they robbed him of ₹3.5 lakh using the same modus operandi. Last year, they had taken lift from the contractor and stole ₹3.5 lakh kept in a bag. On Wednesday, the contractor traced them asking for a lift on the same route.

7.title: Pope Francis visits Italian prison for foot-washing ritual
7.article_body: Pope Francis visited an Italian prison and washed and kissed the feet of 12 inmates in a Holy Thursday ritual that symbolizes humility and service. The 12 inmates included men and women of various ages and different nationalities, the Vatican said. In the past two years, scaled-down versions of the service were held inside the Vatican because of COVID-19 curbs.

8.title: Tribal Odisha woman slits 3-yr-old son's throat in intoxicated state; arrested
8.article_body: A tribal woman from Odisha's Koraput district has been arrested after she, in an intoxicated state, slit the throat of her three-year-old son. Police claimed the accused had a raucous celebration of the Chaiti festival with her husband and neighbours with heavy drinking and feasts. The next day, she came to her senses and started repenting her crime, police added.

9.title: Curfew relaxed in riot-hit Khargone in MP; only women allowed to step out
9.article_body: Curfew was relaxed for two hours on Thursday in Madhya Pradesh's Khargone, where communal clashes broke out during Ram Navami celebrations. According to Khargone Collector Anugrah P, only women were allowed to step out of their homes and buy essential commodities during the two-hour relaxation provided from 10 am. Only milk, vegetable, medical and provision stores were opened.

10.title: Punjab govt must release ₹800 cr dues of sugarcane farmers: Partap Bajwa
10.article_body: Punjab government must release nearly ₹800 crore worth of dues to sugarcane farmers, Leader of Opposition in Vidhan Sabha Partap Singh Bajwa said. "On March 22, I had written to the CM...Till date, I have received no response of the same," the Congress leader added. "This situation is untenable...sugarcane farmers of Punjab have not been paid since February," Bajwa added.

11.title: India has to grow big, those blocking way will be eliminated: RSS chief
11.article_body: Addressing a gathering in Haridwar, RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat said that India has to grow big and its rise is incumbent upon the rise of 'dharma'. Comparing India's progress to that of a vehicle that only has an accelerator and no brakes, Bhagwat said that those trying to stop it "will either step aside or be eliminated".

12.title: She has made the right choice: Alia's brother Rahul on her wedding with Ranbir
12.article_body: Actress Alia Bhatt's half-brother Rahul Bhatt has said her actor husband Ranbir Kapoor is a nice guy and will take care of her. "He'll love her and respect her well. He's a cultured man. I wish him well," he added. "Alia's choice of films are good and she has also made the right choice in her life partner," said Rahul.

13.title: Will be interesting to see how Musk's Twitter offer evolves: Amazon CEO
13.article_body: Amazon CEO Andy Jassy in an interview discussing Tesla CEO Elon Musk's offer to buy Twitter said the news is "very interesting", adding, "We all use Twitter...to some degree...It'll be interesting to see how it evolves." On being asked if Musk is ultimately going to buy Twitter, Jassy said, "I don't know. That's, that's the rumour."

14.title: President Biden will not visit Ukraine: White House
14.article_body: White House Press Secretary Jen Psaki said US President Joe Biden will not visit Ukraine amid the ongoing war. Talking to reporters on Thursday, Biden said he's considering sending a senior US official to Ukraine. Several European leaders, including UK PM Boris Johnson, have visited Ukraine and met President Volodymyr Zelenskyy in recent days in show of support for Kyiv.

15.title: In my era, people slapped DCs to get noticed as politicians: BJP MP
15.article_body: BJP MP Janardan Mishra has claimed that during his era, people used to "slap District Collectors (DCs) or commissioners to get noticed as politicians". Mishra made the remarks while addressing a BJP workers' gathering in Madhya Pradesh's Rewa. "We were aware that slapping senior officials will establish us as political leaders at least for...next one or two years," Mishra added.

16.title: Upset over not being served breakfast, Thane man fires at daughter-in-law
16.article_body: A 76-year-old man allegedly opened fire at his 42-year-old daughter-in-law in Thane after reportedly being annoyed over not being served breakfast along with tea. Police said that the woman suffered bullet injuries in her abdomen and is undergoing treatment. An offence under IPC sections 307 [attempt to murder] and 506 [criminal intimidation] has been registered against accused.

17.title: Man booked 35 years ago in infant murder case acquitted in Mumbai
17.article_body: A Mumbai court acquitted a 68-year-old man, identified as Ramchandra Sharma who was booked 35 years ago, from charges of kidnapping and killing an infant. Sharma was granted bail following his arrest earlier but a non-bailable warrant was issued against him after he was declared absconding. Sharma was booked on suspicion of killing a baby born to his wife.

18.title: Video from Alia Bhatt-Ranbir Kapoor's varmala ceremony goes viral
18.article_body: A video from Alia Bhatt and Ranbir Kapoor's varmala ceremony from their wedding has gone viral on social media. In the video, Ranbir can be seen kneeling down during the ceremony after initially sitting atop the shoulders of his friends. Alia and Ranbir got married in an intimate wedding ceremony on Thursday.

19.title: Take adequate cyber security measures: Hyd Police Commissioner urges banks
19.article_body: In a meeting of representatives from 51 urban cooperative banks on Thursday, Hyderabad City Police Commissioner CV Anand discussed the growing instances of cybercrime. The commissioner explained threats from hackers and urged banks to strengthen their cyber security apparatus. The meeting was convened by RBI in view of the recent Mahesh Bank fraud case involving illegal transfer of ₹12.48 crore.

20.title: What did Elon Musk say when asked why he wanted to acquire Twitter?
20.article_body: Speaking at a TED event, the world’s richest person and Tesla CEO Elon Musk while answering a query on why he wanted to acquire Twitter said it was important for "there to be an arena for free speech". Musk added, "This isn't a way to sort of make money...Having a public platform that is maximally trusted and broadly inclusive, is...important."

21.title: Naga Chaitanya fined ₹700 in Hyd for using tinted glass on his car
21.article_body: Naga Chaitanya on Tuesday had to pay a challan of ₹700 in Hyderabad for using tinted windows on his car. As per reports, the actor was travelling in a Toyota Vellfire when the Jubilee Hills traffic police stopped him. Recently, 'Pushpa' star Allu Arjun was also fined for using tinted windows on his Range Rover in Hyderabad.

22.title: Alia Bhatt, Ranbir Kapoor took 4 pheras at their wedding: Alia's brother Rahul Bhatt
22.article_body: Actress Alia Bhatt's half-brother Rahul Bhatt has revealed that Alia and Ranbir Kapoor took four pheras instead of seven pheras at their wedding. "They had a special pandit...The pandit has been with the Kapoors for many years now," he added. "He explained the significance of each phera...it was really fascinating. We have not been exposed to this," he stated.

23.title: Shane Watson ranks the 'big five' Test batters in order
23.article_body: Ex-Australia all-rounder Shane Watson has ranked the 'big five' Test batters in order. Calling him 'superhuman', Watson ranked Virat Kohli as the number one Test batter. Watson chose Babar Azam as the number two batter, followed by Steve Smith, Kane Williamson and Joe Root. "Smith has just started to come off a little bit," Watson said.

24.title: I used to be frustrated during my TV days as women took up all roles: Vivek
24.article_body: Actor Vivek Mushran said that he used to be frustrated when he worked in the television industry as "women would take up all the roles". "When OTT happened I thought at least men will also get some space, but here too women are ruling the scene...But it feels good...as women are getting to do so much more here," he added.

25.title: Earthquake of magnitude 5.3 hits Arunachal Pradesh
25.article_body: According to the National Center for Seismology (NCS), an earthquake measuring 5.3 magnitude on the Richter scale hit north of Pangin in Arunachal Pradesh on Friday at 6.56 am. "Earthquake of Magnitude 5.3, Occurred on 15-04-2022, 06:56:19 IST, Lat: 38.62 and Long: 97.05, Depth: 30 Km, Location: 1176km N of Pangin, Arunachal Pradesh," NCS tweeted.

26.title: Germany seizes world's largest superyacht 'Dilbar' owned by Russian oligarch
26.article_body: The world's largest superyacht, 'Dilbar', owned by Russian oligarch Alisher Usmanov, has been officially seized by Germany as part of its sanctions against Moscow over the invasion of Ukraine. With two helipads and the largest indoor pool ever installed on a yacht, 'Dilbar' is worth $600 million and it costs $60 million per year to maintain it.

27.title: 25-yr-old man kills self 3 days after wife dies by suicide in Pune
27.article_body: A 25-year-old man allegedly died by suicide in Pune, three days after his wife also took the extreme step. The man reportedly could not bear his wife's loss. According to the police, the man committed the act in the bathroom under the pretext of taking bath after attending his wife's funeral. The wife had apparently died by suicide on Sunday.

28.title: Chhattisgarh CM seeks GST compensation for 10 more years, writes to PM
28.article_body: Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel urged PM Narendra Modi to continue the present compensation grant system of Goods and Services Tax (GST) for another ten years as its discontinuation will bring huge economic loss to the producing state. If it is not continued beyond June 2022, then Chhattisgarh is likely to face a revenue loss of nearly ₹5,000 crore, he said.

29.title: Raj Thackeray is BJP's loudspeaker, people will shut it down: Sanjay Raut
29.article_body: Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut said that MNS chief Raj Thackeray has become BJP's loudspeaker. "This loudspeaker is blaring out of desperation but people will shut it down," Raut added. Raj Thackeray had warned that MNS workers will install speakers outside mosques and play Hanuman Chalisa if loudspeakers from mosques are not removed till May 3.

30.title: Ravi Kishan, Manoj Tiwari to play Kewat, Parashurama in Ayodhya Ram Leela
30.article_body: BJP leaders Ravi Kishan and Manoj Tiwari will be playing the roles of 'Kewat' and 'Parashurama' respectively in Ram Leela that will be held in Ayodhya, Mahant Maithili Ramansharan Maharaj of Shri Lakshman Kila said. Reports said that last year, actress Bhagyashree and actor Rahul Bhuchar played the roles of Goddess Sita and Lord Ram respectively.

31.title: Amazon not close to accepting crypto, don't have Bitcoin myself: CEO
31.article_body: Amazon CEO Andy Jassy in an interview with CNBC said the e-commerce firm is not close to adding cryptocurrency as a payment option to its retail business. "I don't have Bitcoin myself," Jassy said. However, he said it might be possible for Amazon to sell NFTs and that he expects NFTs to continue to grow "significantly".

32.title: Stones pelted at Congress leader V Hanumantha Rao's house in Hyderabad
32.article_body: Unidentified persons pelted stones at senior Congress leader V Hanumantha Rao's house in Hyderabad's Amberpet, police said. A car parked in front of the house was also damaged in the incident. Rao, while condemning the attack, criticised the state government for failing to ensure his security. He claimed he had approached Telangana DGP after receiving threat calls in the past.

33.title: Former Gujarat Congress MLA Pravin Maru joins BJP
33.article_body: Former Congress MLA from Gujarat's Gadhada constituency Pravin Maru on Thursday joined BJP at the party's state headquarters in Gandhinagar. Maru had resigned as Congress MLA in March 2020. "I had been with the Congress party for 30 years, but it failed to form a government," Maru said. "Whichever responsibility BJP gives me, I will accept it," he further said.

34.title: Elephant tramples elderly couple to death in Jharkhand's Hazaribagh
34.article_body: An elderly couple was killed on Thursday after being trampled on by an elephant in Jharkhand's Hazaribagh. According to Forest Range Officer Annand Kumar Singh, the elephant attacked 65-year-old Vedlal Pandit and his 60-year-old wife Shanti Devi when they were working in a field. While Vedlal died on the spot, Shanti succumbed to her injuries on the way to hospital.

35.title: Saudi Prince Alwaleed bin Talal rejects Musk's Twitter takeover bid
35.article_body: Saudi Arabian investor Prince Alwaleed bin Talal, one of the major shareholders in Twitter, has rejected a takeover bid by billionaire entrepreneur Elon Musk. "I don't believe that the proposed offer by Elon Musk ($54.20 per share) comes close to the intrinsic value of Twitter given its growth prospects," he said. Musk has offered to buy Twitter for $43 billion.

36.title: 62-yr-old man jailed without bail for shooting 10 at New York subway
36.article_body: A 62-year-old man accused of shooting 10 commuters at a Brooklyn subway station was jailed on Thursday without bail after prosecutors argued he posed a "serious and ongoing danger to the community". Frank James is charged with a federal terrorism offence that applies to attacks on mass transit systems. Assistant US Attorney Sara Winik said the attack was "premeditated".

37.title: 3 soldiers lose lives as vehicle overturns on way to encounter site in J&K
37.article_body: At least three soldiers lost their lives and five were injured after their vehicle overturned while en route to an encounter site in Jammu and Kashmir's Shopian on Thursday, PRO (Defence) Srinagar said. The driver seemingly lost control due to wet road conditions, it added. It also clarified that the reports of the accident being caused by stone-pelting were false.

38.title: 4 LeT militants linked to 6 terror crimes killed in encounter in J&K
38.article_body: Four Lashkar-e-Taiba terrorists who were linked to six terror crimes, including attacks on non-resident labourers, were killed in an encounter in Jammu and Kashmir's Shopian on Thursday, IGP Kashmir Vijay Kumar said. Police had launched a search operation in the area based on specific information. "The hiding terrorists fired indiscriminately upon the search party," a police spokesperson said.

39.title: Major tech firms calling lawyers asking if they can buy Twitter: Cuban
39.article_body: Reacting to Tesla CEO Elon Musk's offer to acquire Twitter for $43 billion, US billionaire investor Mark Cuban took to Twitter. Cuban tweeted, "Every major tech company, Google, FB, et al is on the phone with their antitrust lawyers asking if they can buy Twitter...Twitter is on the phone with their lawyers asking which can be their white knight."

40.title: Yuvraj praises Buttler for sportsmanship, fans accuse him of taking 'cheap shot' at Ashwin
40.article_body: Yuvraj Singh took to Twitter to praise RR's Jos Buttler for his sportsmanship during RR's match against GT. In his tweet, Yuvraj wrote, "Other players should learn from him...specially teammates!" Fans accused Yuvraj of taking "cheap shot" at Ravichandran Ashwin. "What is this obsession with Ashwin," a fan wrote. "You could've appreciated Buttler without targeting Ashwin," wrote another.

41.title: Woman who was caught after she jumped off Delhi metro station building dies
41.article_body: A woman who jumped off Akshardham Metro Station building in Delhi on Thursday died during treatment at a hospital. The woman was caught by the security staff, however she sustained serious injuries. "She was a resident of Hoshiarpur in Punjab, worked in Gurugram, and had quit her job recently," DCP Metro Jitendra Mani said.

42.title: Delhi govt passes budget of ₹476.89 cr for development of mandis
42.article_body: Delhi government on Thursday passed a budget of ₹476.89 crore for the development of mandis in the city for the financial year 2022-23. Delhi Development Minister Gopal Rai said that CCTVs will be installed in all the mandis and renovation of Azadpur Mandi's Kisan Bhawan will be carried out. Notably, the government has allocated ₹178.73 crore to APMC Azadpur.

43.title: Over 1,000 houses damaged in a cyclonic storm in Meghalaya; 47 villages affected
43.article_body: Over 1,000 houses in Meghalaya's Ri Bhoi district were damaged in a cyclonic storm that hit the district on Thursday, a senior district official said. "Prima facie, 47 villages in the district were affected in the storm," he added. "One temporary shelter has been set up in Syadheh village as standby," said Ri Bhoi Deputy Commissioner (DC) Arpit Upadhyaya.

44.title: Babasaheb rose above discrimination and laid down the Constitution: CM Yogi
44.article_body: Speaking at an event organised to mark Babasaheb Bhimrao Ambedkar's 131st birth anniversary, Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath said that Ambedkar was a person who rose above "discrimination". "Think of the times and social conditions that existed 131 years ago. But Babasaheb...laid down the Constitution...without ever hinting at the prejudice and inequality he faced," CM Yogi Adityanath said.

45.title: Member of ISIS' 'Beatles' cell convicted in US for beheading hostages
45.article_body: A US jury has convicted a 33-year-old ex-British citizen for his role in the ISIS hostage-taking scheme that led to the beheading of Americans in Syria and Iraq. El Shafee Elsheikh, a member of ISIS cell dubbed "the Beatles", was found guilty on eight counts, including kidnapping and murder. Elsheikh is the highest-profile ISIS fighter to stand trial in US.

46.title: India reports 949 new COVID-19 cases, active cases in country at 11,191
46.article_body: India has reported 949 new COVID-19 cases and six deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. Active COVID-19 cases in India stand at 11,191, while the death toll has risen to 5,21,743. The country saw 810 recoveries in the last 24 hours, the ministry said.

47.title: Indian documentary 'All That Breathes' to screen at Cannes Film Festival
47.article_body: India's 'All That Breathes', a documentary by Delhi-based filmmaker Shaunak Sen, will premiere in the Special Screening segment at the upcoming Cannes Film Festival, the organisers announced on Thursday. The 90-minute documentary follows the journey of two brothers, Mohammad and Nadeem, who work with injured birds, especially the black kites. The film festival will be held from May 17-28.

48.title: Passenger's phone catches fire mid-air on IndiGo flight, no injuries caused
48.article_body: A passenger's mobile phone caught fire mid-air on IndiGo's Dibrugarh-Delhi flight on Thursday and the cabin crew was able to douse it with a fire extinguisher. As per the DGCA officials, there was no injury caused to any passenger or cabin crew member due to it. A crew member had first spotted sparks and smoke emitting from the passenger's phone.

49.title: Bombay gymkhana ran eating house without health licence for 2 years, RTI reveals
49.article_body: Bombay Gymkhana, one of the oldest clubs in Mumbai, was running its eating house without a mandatory health licence for two years, an RTI filed by activist Sanjay Gurav revealed. The one-year health licence of the eating house expired on December 23, 2019, and since then it has been operating without permission, an inspection conducted by BMC officials revealed.

50.title: I'd watch KBC, dream of working with him: Aakanksha on 'Runway..' co-star Big B
50.article_body: Actress Aakanksha Singh who will be sharing screen space with actor Amitabh Bachchan in 'Runway 34', said that she used to dream about working with him when she used to watch the show 'Kaun Banega Crorepati'. "Being with him on sets...seeing him perform...is a great learning experience. He is an...institution in himself and is an inspiration for me," she added.

51.title: Bhagwant Mann’s character is purer than 24 karat gold: Raghav Chadha
51.article_body: Aam Aadmi Party national spokesperson Raghav Chadha said that the character of Punjab Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann is "purer than 24 karat gold". His comments came after SAD chief Sukhbir Singh Badal accused Maan visiting Takht Damdama Sahib while being drunk. Sukhbir also said that Mann had visited the holy place in a drunken state even earlier.

52.title: 24-yr-old man gets 10-yr jail for carrying 250 gm charas in Chandigarh
52.article_body: A local court in Chandigarh sentenced a 24-year-old man to 10 years of rigorous imprisonment for carrying 250 grams of charas in 2019. The convict, Sajan, was caught by the police after they spotted him trying to evade detection at a check post in May 2019. Upon checking, they had recovered the drug from a polybag that he was carrying.

53.title: Punjab man stalks & assaults woman, steals her undergarments; booked
53.article_body: A 58-year-old man in Punjab's Machipur has been booked for allegedly assaulting a 47-year-old woman since 2005. The woman claimed that the accused trespassed into her house and stole her undergarments. He also urinated in front of her, making obscene gestures in public, she claimed. She alleged he assaulted her and tore her shirt at a school where she works.

54.title: Apple testing 9 new Macs with 4 different M2 chip variants: Report
54.article_body: Apple has started testing several new Mac models with the next-generation M2 chips, Bloomberg News reported citing sources. It's testing at least nine Mac models with four different M2-based chips with third-party apps in its App store. It's also testing a Mac mini with an M1 Pro chip, the same processor used in the entry-level 14-inch and 16-inch MacBook Pros.

55.title: Heavy rain causes waterlogging in B'luru; 1 electrocuted to death
55.article_body: A 21-year-old man was electrocuted to death in Bengaluru as heavy rainfall caused waterlogging in the city on Thursday. The man was reportedly electrocuted when he came in close contact with a cut wire, however, BESCOM claimed they'd cut the power in the area. The BBMP also said that about 12 trees had been uprooted due to the wind speed.

56.title: Auto driver booked for pelting stones at BEST bus driver in Mumbai
56.article_body: An auto-rickshaw driver has been booked by police for injuring a BEST bus driver by throwing stones at him in Mumbai. According to police, the incident occurred on Wednesday night when BEST bus driver, Kailash Daatkhile, had to apply emergency brakes after an auto stopped suddenly. Daatkhile allegedly shouted at the auto driver who then pelted stones in retaliation.

57.title: Upgraded AC local trains to be introduced by 2023 in Mumbai: Report
57.article_body: The new AC local trains with upgraded seating arrangements and increased space are expected to be introduced on Mumbai's railway tracks by 2023, reported HT. The trains will have metro-like interiors with longitude seatings and additional space for passengers to travel inside the train, the report said. The upgraded AC locals will have separate luggage compartments, the report added.

58.title: 75-year-old man stabbed to death at his home in Gurugram's Sector 69
58.article_body: A 75-year-old man was allegedly stabbed to death at his four-storey residence in Gurugram's Sector 69 on Wednesday, police said. The deceased was stabbed at least six times in the neck with a sharp weapon used for breaking ice slabs, police added. The suspects allegedly rang the doorbell of the deceased's flat after climbing to the third floor, police stated.

59.title: Thieves bought second-hand car, cleared debts with loot from Sonam's house
59.article_body: The nurse and her husband, who were arrested for a theft of cash and jewellery worth ₹2.4 crore from the residence of Sonam Kapoor's in-laws, used the money to pay off their debt, cover their parents' treatment costs and bought a second-hand car. The police said the nurse would steal valuables from the room after giving sedatives to Sonam's mother-in-law.

60.title: Sex racket busted at Pune spa; 6 including 4 women from Thailand rescued
60.article_body: Pune City Police has busted a sex racket operating from a spa centre in Aundh and has rescued six women, including four from Thailand. The manager of the spa has been arrested, police said, adding that two other persons have been booked for allegedly running the sex racket. "Visa details of the four women are being probed," an officer said.

61.title: 4 including 2 women held for running prostitution racket in Navi Mumbai
61.article_body: Police have arrested four people, including two women, for allegedly running a prostitution racket in Navi Mumbai's Vashi area. According to police, the accused used to lure customers over the phone and meet them at designated places. Vashi police then laid a trap by sending dummy customers and caught the accused near a lodge in Juhu Gaon.

62.title: 55 homes of man who says Putin is godfather to his daughter seized by Ukraine
62.article_body: Ukrainian authorities on Thursday said they have seized 154 assets belonging to pro-Russian politician Viktor Medvedchuk. The assets include 23 houses, 32 apartments, 30 plots of land, 26 cars, and one yacht, The Washington Post reported. Medvedchuk, who says Russian President Vladimir Putin is godfather to his daughter, was arrested earlier this week.

63.title: Jonty Rhodes touches Sachin Tendulkar's feet after IPL match, video goes viral
63.article_body: A video went viral on social media showing Punjab Kings (PBKS) assistant coach Jonty Rhodes touching Mumbai Indians (MI) mentor Sachin Tendulkar's feet following the IPL 2022 match between MI and PBKS. Sachin was seen trying to stop Rhodes from touching his feet while the teams were greeting each other. "Watch IPL just for moments like these," a fan tweeted.

64.title: Those b*******: Musk on SEC over his 2018 Tesla tweets settlement
64.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk while discussing his SEC settlement over his 2018 Tesla tweets said, "I was forced to concede to the SEC unlawfully. Those b*******." He added he was forced to settle as banks threatened to cease providing capital and Tesla could have gone bankrupt. "I was forced to admit that I lied to save Tesla's life," Musk said.

65.title: 14-yr-old boy rapes 13-yr-old girl, threatens with scissors in Pune
65.article_body: A 14-year-old boy has been booked for allegedly threatening a 13-year-old girl with scissors and then raping her in Pune. The incident had occurred on April 3 when the accused forcibly entered the house while the girl was alone, the girl's father claimed in the complaint. The accused had reportedly also threatened to kill the girl's parents.

66.title: Hardik Pandya apologises to Prasidh Krishna after edging ball to four, video goes viral
66.article_body: Gujarat Titans (GT) captain Hardik Pandya was seen apologising to Rajasthan Royals (RR) fast bowler Prasidh Krishna after scoring a boundary through a thick outside edge on the last delivery of their innings. Prasidh was seen smiling after Hardik apologised. Hardik scored 87*(52) as his team defeated RR by 37 runs.

67.title: Not sure if I'll be able to acquire Twitter, have a Plan B too: Musk
67.article_body: After making an offer to acquire Twitter, Tesla CEO Elon Musk said he wasn’t sure if he'll be "actually able to acquire it." Speaking at a TED event, Musk also said he has a Plan B if Twitter rejected his offer. He said his offer was to create "an inclusive arena for free speech" and not to make money.

68.title: 1 dead, 5 injured in AC compressor explosion in Delhi's Jamia Nagar
68.article_body: A man died and five others were injured after an air-conditioner compressor exploded which led to a fire at an eatery in Delhi's Jamia Nagar on Thursday, police said. Earlier, officials said 13 people were injured following a cylinder blast, however, police later confirmed it was an AC compressor explosion. The fire was extinguished within an hour, an official added.

69.title: Russian warship sinks after being hit by Ukrainian missile
69.article_body: Russia has said its warship Moskva sank on Thursday after an explosion and fire that Ukraine claimed was caused by a missile strike. The warship sank as it was being towed to port in stormy weather, Russian news agencies quoted the defence ministry as saying. Ukraine said it hit the warship with a Ukrainian-made Neptune anti-ship missile.

70.title: Mumbai man complains about people playing cricket till 2:30 am, police respond
70.article_body: A Twitter user, while tagging Mumbai police in his tweet, complained of disturbance being caused due to people playing cricket at night. "Night cricket...has become nuisance...Is it legal? They play till 2.30 am...and [are] very noisy...It disturbs our sleep...not to mention we have senior citizens in building," he wrote. Mumbai police said they have informed main control room about issue.

71.title: Mumbai man kills 17-year-old female friend in hotel, later dies by suicide
71.article_body: A 21-year-old man allegedly killed his 17-year-old female friend in a hotel and then killed himself by jumping in front of a running train in Mumbai. Police said the duo was in a relationship and the girl had sent some intimate pictures of herself to him. The man allegedly demanded money from her and threatened to post her pictures online.

72.title: Twitter not held hostage by Musk's offer, CEO Parag tells staff: Report
72.article_body: Twitter CEO Parag Agrawal, while reassuring the staff, said that they weren't being "held hostage" by the news of Tesla CEO Elon Musk's offer to buy the company, a source told Reuters. Agrawal also encouraged employees to remain focused and said that "we as employees control what happens". On Thursday, Musk offered to acquire Twitter for $43 billion.

73.title: Jumped in river but couldn't find them: Uncle of boys who drowned in Delhi
73.article_body: Omar Shahid, uncle of Sahil and Mohd Ali who along with their two friends drowned in the Yamuna while playing in Delhi's Kalindi Kunj area, said he found the boys' clothes on the riverbank. "I jumped into the river but couldn't find them...I got scared and called police," Shahid said. Police said three out of four bodies have been recovered.

74.title: GT defeat RR to jump to top of points table, record their highest total in IPL 2022
74.article_body: GT defeated RR by 37 runs to register their fourth win and jump to the top of IPL 2022 points table. GT put up a total of 192/4, their highest total in IPL 2022 so far. GT captain Hardik Pandya top-scored with 87*(52). GT pacers Lockie Ferguson and Yash Dayal took three wickets each as RR were restricted to 155/9.

75.title: COVID-19 cases, deaths drop for 3rd straight week: WHO
75.article_body: In its weekly report, the World Health Organization (WHO) said global COVID-19 cases and deaths dropped for a third consecutive week. WHO said between April 4 to 10 over seven million cases and over 22,000 deaths were reported across the six WHO regions, representing a 24% drop in cases and 18% drop in deaths compared to the previous week.

76.title: We know that the season has only just begun: Ferrari President Elkann
76.article_body: Ferrari President John Elkann said Ferrari understands that "the season has only just begun" after winning two out of the three races so far this season. Ferrari's Charles Leclerc won in Bahrain and Australia while finishing second in Saudi Arabia. "Like all our fans around the world, I am happy to be back competing at the highest level," Elkann said.

77.title: Russia trying to recruit our citizens to fight in Ukraine: Moldova
77.article_body: Moldova on Thursday accused Russia of trying to recruit its citizens from the country's breakaway region of Transdniestria to fight in Ukraine. This comes days after British military intelligence made similar claims, adding that Russia wants to boost its troop buildup in Ukraine. Located in eastern Moldova, Transdniestria is a narrow strip of land controlled by pro-Russian separatists.

78.title: India's Pujara, Pakistan's Rizwan make their Sussex debut together, club shares pic
78.article_body: Indian batter Cheteshwar Pujara and Pakistani wicketkeeper-batter Muhammad Rizwan made their debut for county cricket club Sussex today. Sussex took to Twitter to share a picture of Pujara and Rizwan posing together wearing their debut caps ahead of their match against Derbyshire. "What an amazing picture," a fan commented on the picture.

79.title: Have gained a wonderful son: Alia's mother Soni Razdan on Ranbir
79.article_body: After Alia Bhatt tied the knot with Ranbir Kapoor on Thursday, Alia's mother Soni Razdan took to Instagram and congratulated the couple. "They say you lose a daughter when you gain a son. I say we gain a wonderful son, a lovely...family," Soni captioned the post. "My darling beautiful baby girl is right here with us always," she added.

80.title: World no. 5 Tsitsipas beats Djere to reach Monte Carlo Masters QFs
80.article_body: World number five Stefanos Tsitsipas on Thursday beat Laslo Djere 7-5, 7-6(1) to reach the quarter-finals of the ATP Masters 1000 tournament in Monte Carlo. Tsitsipas has won seven ATP Tour titles so far in his career. The 23-year-old will face Argentina's Diego Schwartzman in the quarter-finals. Tsitsipas won his maiden ATP Masters 1000 title in Monte Carlo last year.

81.title: Wind & light rainfall bring relief from heat in parts of Delhi
81.article_body: Residents got a brief relief from the scorching heat on Thursday evening as gusty winds and very light rainfall were reported in parts of Delhi-NCR. The maximum temperature was recorded at 39.4°C, three degrees above normal, at the Safdarjung weather observatory. At 8:30 pm, the temperature fell to 29.4°C. IMD predicted the temperature to reach around 42°C on April 18.

82.title: UK, EU impose further sanctions on 178 Russian separatists
82.article_body: The UK and EU on Wednesday imposed new sanctions on 178 Russian separatists over Russia's invasion of Ukraine. "In the wake of the horrific rocket attacks on civilians in eastern Ukraine, we are today sanctioning those who prop up the illegal breakaway regions and are complicit in atrocities against the Ukrainian people," Britain's Foreign Secretary Liz Truss said.

83.title: Goldsmith who bought jewellery stolen from Sonam's home held; ₹1cr jewellery recovered
83.article_body: The Delhi Police Crime Branch has arrested a goldsmith who purchased the stolen jewellery belonging to actress Sonam Kapoor's mother-in-law. Police said they have recovered stolen jewellery worth more than ₹1 crore that included 100 diamonds, six gold chains, diamond bangles and a diamond bracelet. The jewellery was stolen by a caregiver employed for Sonam's mother-in-law.

84.title: 4 South Korean women killed as car crashes with truck in Australia
84.article_body: Police on Thursday said four South Korean women, all aged in their 20s, were killed when their car crashed with a truck in the state of Queensland on Wednesday evening. Assistant Police Commissioner Mike Condon said one of the women failed to give way to the truck at an intersection on the highway causing the collision.

85.title: Picture of Ranbir, Alia cutting cake at their wedding surfaces online
85.article_body: A picture of Ranbir Kapoor and Alia Bhatt cutting a cake at their wedding has surfaced online. This comes after Ranbir and Alia tied the knot on Thursday. In another picture, the couple could be seen drinking champagne. The duo got married after dating for five years. Karan Johar, Karisma Kapoor, Kareena Kapoor were among those who attended the wedding.

86.title: Father would be blessing PM Modi: Ex-PM's son on museum for PMs
86.article_body: Neeraj Shekhar, who is a BJP MP and son of late PM Chandra Shekhar, thanked PM Narendra Modi for the Pradhanmantri Sangrahalaya, a museum dedicated to every PM of India since independence. Calling PM Modi a true statesman above party lines, Shekhar wrote, "Wherever he is, my father would be blessing PM Modi...So would all other Prime Ministers."

87.title: World no. 3 Zverev beats Delbonis to reach Monte Carlo Masters last 16
87.article_body: World number three Alexander Zverev on Wednesday beat Federico Delbonis 6-1, 7-5 to reach the last 16 of the ATP Masters 1000 event in Monte Carlo. "This is the only Masters on clay I haven't won yet, but I'm very motivated to do so," Zverev said. The 24-year-old German has won five ATP Masters 1000 titles so far.

88.title: Delhi sees 325 COVID-19 cases in 24 hrs, active cases cross 900
88.article_body: Delhi on Thursday added 325 fresh COVID-19 cases to its tally while the number of active cases was recorded at 915. No coronavirus-related deaths were registered in the last 24 hours and the positivity rate stood at 2.39%. Amid a rise in cases, Delhi Disaster Management Authority (DDMA) will hold a meeting on April 20, an official confirmed today.

89.title: Congratulations to both of you, all the love & happiness: Katrina to Ranbir-Alia
89.article_body: Actress Katrina Kaif on Thursday congratulated newlywed Bollywood couple Ranbir Kapoor and Alia Bhatt. "Congratulations to both of u (you)...All the love and happiness," Katrina commented on the couple's wedding pictures shared by Alia Bhatt on Instagram. "Today, surrounded by our family and friends, at home...we got married," Alia captioned her wedding pictures.

90.title: World no. 8 Rublev beats De Minaur to reach Monte Carlo Masters last 16
90.article_body: World number eight Andrey Rublev on Wednesday beat Alex de Minaur 2-6, 6-1, 6-4 to reach the last 16 of the ATP Masters 1000 tournament in Monte Carlo. Rublev will face world number 12 Jannik Sinner for a spot in the quarter-finals. Rublev reached the final of the tournament in Monte Carlo last year where he lost to Stefanos Tsitsipas.

91.title: We must remain ever vigilant against divisiveness: CJI Ramana
91.article_body: CJI NV Ramana on Friday said one must remain ever vigilant against divisiveness and only through unity can peace and progress be achieved. While visiting Amritsar's Partition Museum, Ramana said, "This museum reminds us of our tragic past and warns us against divisions of all kinds...This dark chapter in our history should serve as a lesson to mankind."

92.title: PM realising Ambedkar's dream by ensuring equal rights for everyone: Irani
92.article_body: Union Minister Smriti Irani on Thursday said that BR Ambedkar was a great national hero, adding that PM Narendra Modi is realising his dream by ensuring equal rights for everyone. She also said that the PM has taken a pledge for the betterment of society by rising above the politics of casteism and regionalism.

93.title: Tottenham Hotspur manager Antonio Conte tests positive for COVID-19
93.article_body: Tottenham Hotspur manager Antonio Conte tested positive for COVID-19 over the weekend. However, the Italian is expected to be symptom-free and available to take charge of their next Premier League match against Brighton and Hove Albion on Saturday. Tottenham beat Aston Villa 4-0 in their last game leaving them in fourth place on the Premier League table with 57 points.

94.title: Pakistan Army Chief Qamar Javed Bajwa to retire in November
94.article_body: Pakistan's Chief of Army Staff General Qamar Javed Bajwa won't seek a term extension and will retire in November this year, the country's military media wing confirmed on Thursday. The announcement comes days after reports claimed that ex-Pakistani PM Imran Khan had tried to dismiss Bajwa, a claim Khan has denied. Bajwa has served as Pakistan's Army Chief since 2016.

95.title: Viral video shows Ranbir carrying Alia in his arms as they pose for the media
95.article_body: A viral video shows actor Ranbir Kapoor carrying actress Alia Bhatt in his arms as they posed for the media following their wedding ceremony on Thursday. The photographers can be heard cheering for the couple in the video. The couple wore outfits by fashion designer Sabyasachi for the wedding ceremony.

96.title: I don't want to praise myself too much but I can be the best finisher for India: Parag
96.article_body: Talking about his aspirations, RR's 20-year-old all-rounder Riyan Parag said, "I don't want to praise myself too much, but I think I can be the best finisher not just for Rajasthan Royals but for India in years to come." He added, "I have got the skill-set, I've got all-rounder abilities and not just batting, fielding and bowling as well."

97.title: On the right side of history: China on its Russia stand after US' criticism
97.article_body: After US warning that China's unwillingness to sanction Russia amid war could affect its relations with other economies, Chinese Foreign Ministry spokesperson Zhao Lijian said, "China is playing a constructive role in the Ukraine issue." "We oppose unfounded accusations and suspicions against China...Time will tell that China's claims are on the right side of history," Zhao added.

98.title: Bank of India files for insolvency proceedings against Future Retail
98.article_body: Bank of India on Thursday filed a petition with the National Company Law Tribunal to initiate insolvency proceedings against Future Retail for non-payment of dues. This comes amid an ongoing legal battle between Future Retail and Amazon over the former's ₹24,713 crore deal with Reliance Industries. "Amazon wanted to destroy us...they've destroyed us," Future Retail had said earlier.

99.title: Ukraine-returned medical students to protest in Delhi on Sunday
99.article_body: Medical students who were forced to return to Punjab from Ukraine and their parents will join a pan-India protest at Jantar Mantar in New Delhi on April 17. The protest will be staged to urge the Central government for making arrangements for students to help them complete their studies in state universities in the country.

100.title: Ashamed: BJP's Agnimitra Paul on Mamata's Nadia rape case remark
100.article_body: BJP's Agnimitra Paul on Wednesday reacted to Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee's comment on alleged gangrape and murder of a 14-year-old girl in Nadia, stating that she's "ashamed". Paul claimed that case was handed over to CBI as Calcutta HC doesn't trust Bengal's administration. Mamata had remarked that the rape victim could have had an affair with accused or been pregnant.

101.title: Have always been selective about projects that I take on: Kareena
101.article_body: Kareena Kapoor Khan has said that she has always been selective about the projects she works on. "If I genuinely find a script interesting, I am immediately on board," she stated. "For me, the right project is always about the story and character and also the people who will be with me on the journey of that project," Kareena added.

102.title: WhatsApp announces new 'Communities' feature to connect multiple groups
102.article_body: WhatsApp on Thursday announced a new 'Communities' feature that will enable users to bring together separate groups under one umbrella with a structure that works for them. "People can receive updates sent to the entire Community and easily organise smaller discussion groups on what matters to them," said WhatsApp. "Communities will also contain powerful new tools for admins," added WhatsApp.

103.title: Viral video shows Ranbir carrying Alia in his arms as they pose for the media
103.article_body: A viral video shows actor Ranbir Kapoor carrying actress Alia Bhatt in his arms as they posed for the media following their wedding ceremony on Thursday. The photographers can be heard cheering for the couple in the video. The couple wore outfits by fashion designer Sabyasachi for the wedding ceremony.

104.title: PM's portrait removed from govt office in Tamil Nadu, video surfaces
104.article_body: A controversy erupted after a video purportedly showed PM Narendra Modi's portrait being removed from Veppathur Town Panchayat's office in Thanjavur district in Tamil Nadu. The panchayat chairman allegedly removed the portrait at her husband's instructions. Subsequently, BJP workers in Kumbakonam lodged a complaint. The video was shared by several BJP leaders, including Tejasvi Surya.

105.title: Punjab govt won't purchase new vehicles for Ministers: CM Mann
105.article_body: Punjab Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann on Thursday ruled out any possibility of the state government purchasing any new vehicles for Ministers. Previously, Mann defended the "remote control" allegation by the Opposition and said that the senior officials of the state government had gone to Delhi for training purposes on his orders.

106.title: Our doors are open for Cong's Hardik Patel: AAP Gujarat chief
106.article_body: AAP Gujarat chief Gopal Italia said his party's doors are open to welcome Gujarat Congress Working President Hardik Patel. "We will definitely welcome such a revolutionary youth leader of Gujarat. We have seen his acceptability and liking," Italia said. Patel had said his position in Congress was "like a newly wedded groom who has been made to undergo a vasectomy".

107.title: Alia Bhatt and Ranbir Kapoor get married, share pics
107.article_body: Ranbir Kapoor and Alia Bhatt got married on Thursday in an intimate wedding ceremony. Alia shared pictures and wrote, "Surrounded by our family and friends, at home...in our favourite spot - the balcony we've spent...last 5 years of our relationship - we got married." "With so much already behind us, we can't wait to build more memories together," she added.

108.title: Alia Bhatt and Ranbir Kapoor make 1st public appearance as a married couple
108.article_body: Actors Alia Bhatt and Ranbir Kapoor, who got married on Thursday, made their first public appearance as a married couple following the wedding ceremony. They posed in front of the media for pictures. The wedding ceremony took place at the Vastu building in Mumbai and was attended by family members and close friends.

109.title: Dolphin stranded on a beach dies after beachgoers try to ride it in US; pic surfaces
109.article_body: A dolphin stranded on a beach in US' Texas died after people harassed and attempted to ride it. "If a live dolphin...strands in Texas, please DO NOT PUSH the animal back to sea, do not attempt to swim or interact with them, do not crowd them," Texas Marine Mammal Stranding Network said while sharing pictures of the incident.

110.title: Table-toppers RR to bowl first against GT, Trent Boult out due to injury
110.article_body: Table-toppers Rajasthan Royals (RR) captain Sanju Samson won the toss and elected to bowl first against Gujarat Titans (GT) in their IPL 2022 match. RR fast bowler Trent Boult won't feature in today's match due to an injury. He has been replaced by Jimmy Neesham. GT have included Yash Dayal and Vijay Shankar in their playing XI.

111.title: This is not a threat: Elon Musk in his offer to buy Twitter
111.article_body: Elon Musk, in his offer to buy Twitter, said, "If the deal...doesn't work...given that I don't have confidence in management nor do I believe I can drive necessary change in public market...I'd need to reconsider my position as a shareholder." He added, "This isn't a threat, it's simply not a good investment without the changes that need to be made."

112.title: Matter of pride that most of our PMs are from humble families: PM
112.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Thursday said it's a great pride for Indians that most of our PMs belonged to humble families. "Coming from a remote countryside, from a very poor family, coming from a farmer's family, reaching the post of PM, this strengthens the faith in the great traditions of Indian democracy," he said at the inauguration of 'Pradhanmantri Sangrahalaya'.

113.title: I once told Ratan Tata that RSS doesn't discriminate on religion: Gadkari
113.article_body: Union Minister Nitin Gadkari said, "I once told industrialist Ratan Tata that RSS doesn't discriminate on religion." Gadkari said that years ago, he had approached Tata for the inauguration of a hospital named after an RSS leader. Gadkari added, "Tata asked if the hospital was only for Hindus as it belongs to RSS...I told him discrimination doesn't happen in RSS."

114.title: Sony had said 2 black actors don't sell overseas: Michael on 'Bad Boys'
114.article_body: Filmmaker Michael Bay said Sony Pictures Studios had no faith in his 1995 film 'Bad Boys' starring Will Smith and Martin Lawrence. "Sony didn't believe in the movie because [they said] two black actors don't sell overseas," Michael stated. The film earned $141 million worldwide. The second and third instalments of the film were released in 2003 and 2020, respectively.

115.title: 'Jersey' release was postponed due to plagiarism case: Producer
115.article_body: 'Jersey' producer Aman Gill has said that the release of Shahid Kapoor and Mrunal Thakur-starrer film was postponed due to the plagiarism case. The case was filed by writer Rajneesh Jaiswal who claimed that the movie's story/script belonged to him. "We didn't want to go ahead and plan a release until the courts gave us a favourable order," Aman stated.

116.title: 'You're now my son-in-law,' jokes Karan Johar after Ranbir's wedding with Alia
116.article_body: Filmmaker Karan Johar took to Instagram and shared a picture with Alia Bhatt and Ranbir Kapoor from their wedding. "It's days like this that we live for...my darling Alia this is such a beautiful life step...Ranbir...you are now my son-in-law," he captioned the post. Karisma Kapoor congratulated the couple on Instagram and wrote, "Wish you both a lifetime of happiness."

117.title: If people love 'KGF 2', we could think of 'KGF 3': Director Prashanth
117.article_body: Filmmaker Prashanth Neel has said that the success of 'KGF: Chapter 2' will determine if they plan to continue the franchise. "It's too early to confirm. In cinema, you can even bring back the dead to life," Neel stated. According to the producers, Yash-starrer 'KGF: Chapter 2' has been released in over 10,000 screens globally.

118.title: Couldn’t have asked for a better addition to our family: Ranbir's sister on Alia
118.article_body: Following Ranbir Kapoor and Alia Bhatt's wedding, Ranbir's sister Riddhima Kapoor Sahni congratulated the couple on Instagram. Sharing a photo of the couple from the wedding, Riddhima wrote, "Couldn't have asked for a better addition to our family! Alia, we love you." "Welcome to the family my precious girl, but you always were a part of it," she added.

119.title: Have watched you become the most loving dad: Kajal to husband Gautam
119.article_body: Actress Kajal Aggarwal, taking to Instagram, thanked her husband Gautam Kitchlu for taking care of her during pregnancy. "Thank you for being the greatest husband + to-be-dad a girl could ask for. Thank you for being so selfless," she captioned the post. "In the past 8 months, I have watched you become the most loving dad," Kajal further wrote.

120.title: Australia imposes new sanctions on 14 Russian state-owned companies
120.article_body: Australia imposed new sanctions against 14 Russian state-owned companies including defence-related entities and shipping companies. Foreign Minister Marise Payne said the new sanctions also extend to Russian Railways and Ruselectronics, an electronic company responsible for the production of about 80% of all Russian electronic components. Australia has sanctioned over 600 entities and individuals.

121.title: Putin said Austria can pay for Russian gas in euros: Chancellor
121.article_body: Austrian Chancellor Karl Nehammer has said that Russian President Vladimir Putin has allowed Austria to continue its payments for Russian gas imports in euros. Nehammer's comments come days after he met Putin in Moscow to discuss Russia's ongoing military offensive in Ukraine. Russia had earlier said that "unfriendly" nations will have to purchase Russian gas in roubles.

122.title: Russia loses its 40th high-ranking officer in Ukraine: Reports
122.article_body: Russia has reportedly lost its 40th high-ranking officer since its invasion of Ukraine began on February 24. Lieutenant Colonel Denis Mezhuev is said to have died in battle according to reports from Russia and Ukraine. Mezhuev was the commander of the 1st Guards Motor Rifle Sevastopol Red Banner regiment. Total Russian casualties are believed to be about 20,000.

123.title: We will review 'unsolicited' offer from Elon Musk: Twitter
123.article_body: Twitter's board will review an "unsolicited, non-binding" offer from Tesla CEO Elon Musk to acquire the social media company, Twitter said on Thursday. With a stake of over 9% in Twitter, Musk has offered to buy the remaining shares at a price of $54.2/share. We will determine the course of action that's in the best interest of shareholders, Twitter added.

124.title: At least 1,000 BJP leaders in Himachal Pradesh to join AAP: Sisodia
124.article_body: At least 1,000 local BJP leaders in Himachal Pradesh will join the AAP, Delhi Deputy Chief Minister Manish Sisodia said on Thursday. "Several big leaders of the BJP are also in touch with us. The BJP is completely scattered in the state now," Sisodia said. He added that the leaders feel BJP won't do anything for the state.

125.title: 'Were you sleeping?’: Owaisi to Guj govt over Ram Navami violence
125.article_body: All India Majlis-e-Ittehadul Muslimeen chief Asaduddin Owaisi on Thursday criticised the Gujarat government and asked if they were "sleeping" during the violence that took place on Ram Navami. "Accept your failure. You yourself are complicit," he said, adding that more police personnel should've been deployed to bring the violence under control. "The government wanted violence," he added.

126.title: BR Ambedkar's statue found disfigured in Noida on birth anniversary
126.article_body: A statue of BR Ambedkar was found disfigured in Uttar Pradesh's Noida on his birth anniversary on Thursday, prompting police to launch a probe into the matter. The incident was reported by locals in the morning and a police spokesperson said a new statue was being installed to replace the disfigured one with the help of residents.

127.title: Amid instability in Pak, India stable due to Ambedkar's Constitution: Pawar
127.article_body: Nationalist Congress Party (NCP) supremo Sharad Pawar said that despite current political instability in Pakistan and Sri Lanka, unity and stability in India have been possible due to its Constitution given by BR Ambedkar. Pawar made these remarks at an event to mark Ambedkar's 131st birth anniversary. "India is a continent-like country...Still, its stability has remained intact," he added.

128.title: Sikhs' contribution to freedom struggle can never be forgotten: Nadda
128.article_body: BJP president Jagat Prakash Nadda on Thursday said that Sikhs' contribution to the freedom struggle and protection of the nation can never be forgotten. "We are delighted that all Sikhs across the world can now connect with Harmandir Sahib, registration has now been done and it was initiated by PM Narendra Modi," he said.

129.title: I'm a big 'bhakt' of Ambedkar, want to spread his message: Kejriwal
129.article_body: On the occasion of Ambedkar Jayanti, Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal said on Thursday that he has been a "big bhakt" of BR Ambedkar since childhood. "I have read about his life and thoughts many times. We have made education about Babasaheb compulsory in schools," he added. Kejriwal further said he wants to ensure that Ambedkar's message "reaches every household".

130.title: Death toll due to heavy rains, floods in South Africa rises over 300
130.article_body: The death toll following deadly floods due to heavy rains in the KwaZulu-Natal province in South Africa has risen to over 300. Officials on Wednesday said the death toll had reached 306. South African President Cyril Ramaphosa on Wednesday pledged to help the victims. "Even though your hearts are in pain, we're here for you," he said.

131.title: Rising tax revenue keeps us on track to becoming $5 tn economy: Govt
131.article_body: The Finance Ministry on Thursday said the government's focus on capital expenditure will boost manufacturing and tax revenue collections, thereby keeping India on track to becoming a $5 trillion economy. Tax revenues in FY22 witnessed a 33.5% rise to ₹27.07 lakh crore. The Ministry added that the government has managed to keep nominal GDP growth above 10% in recent years.

132.title: 60-yr-old woman dies after being beaten by husband in Delhi
132.article_body: A 60-year-old woman died after being beaten by her unemployed husband in Delhi's Bhajanpura. According to police, the couple had gotten into a fight over financial issues last week, during which the accused beat his wife with a stick. She had received multiple injuries but refused to file a complaint, police said. She later died at a hospital during treatment.

133.title: Third Front against BJP not possible without Congress: Sharad Pawar
133.article_body: Talking about Opposition's unity for 2024 Lok Sabha polls, NCP chief Sharad Pawar said that Third Front against BJP is "not possible" without the Congress party. "Congress is still the second biggest party in the country that is why it is important to take them along," Pawar added. Opposition leaders like Mamata Banerjee have called for formation of Third Front.

134.title: Earliest evidence of Maya calendar use found inside Guatemalan pyramid
134.article_body: A glyph representing one of the Mayan calendar's 260 days, called '7 Deer', on mural fragments dating from the third century BC has been found inside the ruins of a pyramid in Guatemala. It represents the earliest-known use of the calendar. Until now, the earliest definitive Maya calendar notation dated to the first century BC.

135.title: PM Modi condoles loss of lives at chemical plant fire in Andhra Pradesh
135.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Thursday condoled the loss of lives due to fire at a chemical factory in Andhra Pradesh. "Pained by...loss of lives due to...mishap at a chemical unit in Eluru, Andhra Pradesh. Condolences to the bereaved families. May the injured recover quickly," PMO tweeted. As many as six persons were killed and 13 injured in the fire accident.

136.title: Death toll from storm Megi in Philippines reaches 123
136.article_body: The death toll from tropical storm Megi that struck the Philippines has reached up to 123. As many as 86 people were killed and 236 injured in Baybay in Leyte province, said the government. The Philippine Army is carrying out the search and rescue operations. Over 1.62 lakh displaced people have reportedly taken shelter in the evacuation centres.

137.title: ED questions ex-Punjab CM Charanjit Singh Channi in illegal sand mining case
137.article_body: Enforcement Directorate (ED) on Wednesday questioned former Punjab CM Charanjit Singh Channi for over six hours in connection with an alleged illegal sand mining case, officials said on Thursday. ED recorded Channi's statement under the Prevention of Money Laundering Act. Channi's nephew Bhupinder Singh Honey was arrested by ED in the same case ahead of the 2022 Punjab Assembly elections.

138.title: Ukraine attention shows bias against black lives: WHO chief
138.article_body: WHO Director-General Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus said the world doesn't give equal attention to emergencies affecting black and white people. The ongoing emergencies in Ethiopia, Yemen, Afghanistan, and Syria have garnered only a "fraction" of the global concern for Ukraine, he added. "The world is not treating the human race the same way...Some are more equal than others," Tedros further said.

139.title: Imran Khan urges Pak's youth to protest against new Pak PM
139.article_body: Addressing a rally in Peshawar, Former Pakistan PM Imran Khan urged the youth of his country to protest against Pakistan's new PM Shehbaz Sharif. Khan also criticised the Sharif-led government's recent crackdown on social media and said that it's not the Pakistan of the 1970s but "Naya Pakistan", where people have the right to raise their voices through social media.

140.title: 2 men held for attacking police personnel with stones in Chandigarh
140.article_body: Two men were arrested for assaulting policemen who were trying to resolve their dispute at Sukhna Enclave in Chandigarh. The police were attacked with stones following which two police personnel were injured and taken to the hospital for treatment. "The other men who were present at the spot and attacked the policemen will also be arrested soon," said an official.

141.title: Bodybuilder Cedric McMillan, ex-Arnold Classic champion, passes away at 44
141.article_body: American bodybuilder Cedric McMillan, who had won the Arnold Classic in 2017, passed away aged 44. McMillan, a long-time veteran of the US Army and National Guard, had become a professional bodybuilder in 2009. He was unable to compete in bodybuilding competitions after 2020 due to health problems including heart issues and COVID-19.

142.title: I'll be more dangerous now: Imran Khan in 1st public address after removal as Pak PM
142.article_body: In his first public address on Wednesday at a rally in Peshawar since losing power, former Pakistan PM Imran Khan said, "I was not dangerous when I was part of the government, but I will be more dangerous now." Khan also asked the judiciary to explain the motive behind opening doors at midnight, hours before his ouster as the PM.

143.title: YouTube account tied to Brooklyn subway shooting suspect removed
143.article_body: YouTube has deleted the account that seemed to belong to the Brooklyn subway shooting suspect. He reportedly talked about violence and mass shootings in videos posted on YouTube, including one uploaded as recently as Monday. A screenshot of the suspect from one of the videos was used on an NYPD flyer seeking information about the shooting.

144.title: 2 held over threat to launch attacks over unemployment in Meghalaya: Report
144.article_body: Two people were reportedly arrested by Meghalaya Police in connection with an email sent to CM Conrad Sangma, announcing the launch of rebel group 'Lawei ba Phyrnai'. The mail threatened to attack educational institutions against rising unemployment in the state. While writing that education does not provide jobs, the sender further claimed they were too smart to be traced.

145.title: Momo sellers fight in Mumbai, seen punching and hitting each other with sticks
145.article_body: A fight erupted between two momo sellers in Mumbai's Powai, with a video of the incident going viral on social media. The incident reportedly took place around 11 pm on Monday. The video of the brawl showed people punching and hitting each other with sticks. Four people were reportedly arrested over the brawl.

146.title: Cong is 'Gangotri' of corruption: Bommai on Cong's protest over contractor's death
146.article_body: Reacting to Congress' demand to arrest KS Eshwarappa in contractor Santosh Patil's death case, Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai said, "Congress doesn't have any moral right to protest." "Congress is a Gangotri of corruption. Postmortem was done yesterday and now preliminary inquiry will come and based on that we'll proceed," he added. "Bommai wants to save his corrupt minister," Congress said.

147.title: Liquid cannabis worth ₹7.17 lakh seized in Andhra’s Chittoor, 4 arrested
147.article_body: The police in Andhra Pradesh's Chittoor district seized 1.435 kg of liquid cannabis worth around ₹7.17 lakh and arrested four persons on Wednesday, police said. Two vehicles have also been seized from the accused's possession. Surveillance on ganja smuggling has been stepped up and police are on high alert to protect youth from drugs, said Anantapur range DIG Ravi Prakash.

148.title: Dharmendra Pradhan reviews welfare programmes in Odisha's Dhenkanal
148.article_body: Union Minister Dharmendra Pradhan on Wednesday reviewed several welfare programmes in Odisha's Dhenkanal. He also visited a Public Distribution System (PDS) Centre and distributed free five kg rice packets among beneficiaries. Notably, around 10 Union Ministers are visiting aspirational districts of Odisha to review the developmental projects undertaken by the central government till April 20.

149.title: There were a lot of crucial moments vs MI and we nailed them: Mayank
149.article_body: PBKS captain Mayank Agarwal has said there were a lot of crucial moments during their game against MI and they nailed them to win the match by 12 runs. "When the game was 50-50, we won those moments and it came towards us...That's the brand of cricket we want to play, we want to play aggressive, hard cricket," he added.

150.title: Russian warship that was told to 'Go f**k yourself' hit by 2 Ukrainian missiles
150.article_body: A Russian warship was seriously damaged after being hit by two Ukrainian Neptune anti-ship cruise missiles. Russian news agencies said the Moskva, commissioned in 1983, was armed with 16 anti-ship Vulkan cruise missiles with a range of at least 700 km. Thirteen Ukrainian soldiers had told Moskva to "Go f**k yourself" in February.

151.title: Suryakumar made an error, he could have waited for Odean: Manjrekar
151.article_body: Commentator Sanjay Manjrekar has said MI batter Suryakumar Yadav made a "slight error" when he decided to get a big over off PBKS pacer Kagiso Rabada on Wednesday. "Suryakumar could've said, 'Rabada is difficult to get away...let it be against Odean Smith'," added Manjrekar. Rabada dismissed Suryakumar in 19th over to help his side win the game by 12 runs.

152.title: Shweta shares pics with 'living legends' Zeenat Aman and Zarina Wahab
152.article_body: Television actress Shweta Tiwari called Zeenat Aman and Zarina Wahab "living legends" as she shared a picture with them on Instagram. Alongside the picture, Shweta wrote, "Ahem...Ahem...Wear your glasses please (sunglasses emoji). Their glow will blind you! #livinglegends." Taking to the comments section, one of the users wrote, "Wow all three legends." Another user commented, "lucky you."

153.title: 5 killed, 13 injured as jeep falls into gorge in Rajasthan's Udaipur
153.article_body: As many as five persons were killed and 13 were injured as a jeep they were travelling in fell into a gorge on Udaipur-Jhadol road in Rajasthan's Udaipur. "Members of a family were returning after attending a family function at Kaliwas when they met with the accident," police said. There were three children among the deceased, police further said.

154.title: Inform district if students show any 'flu-like' symptoms: Noida official
154.article_body: With the spike in COVID-19 cases among children in Noida, the Chief Medical Officer (CMO) of GB Nagar asked the education department to "immediately inform" if any flu-like symptoms are seen among students. "You are requested to immediately inform the COVID helpline 1800492211 or write to the email id cmogbnr@gmail.com...so that timely action can be taken," the CMO said.

155.title: Vice President calls for intensified efforts towards early detection of leprosy cases
155.article_body: Vice President M Venkaiah Naidu called for intensified efforts for early detection of leprosy cases, equitable access to appropriate treatment and integrated leprosy services. India successfully accomplished levels of leprosy eradication defined as less than one case per ten thousand population, Naidu said. "NLEP has been at the forefront of the battle against leprosy," Naidu stated.

156.title: PM Modi inaugurates 'Pradhanmantri Sangrahalaya' in Delhi, buys 1st ticket
156.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Thursday inaugurated the 'Pradhanmantri Sangrahalaya', a museum in tribute to every Prime Minister since Independence, in Delhi. PM Modi bought the first ticket at the museum ahead of the inauguration. The Sangrahalaya tells the story of India after Independence through the lives and contributions of its Prime Ministers, the PMO said in a press release.

157.title: 2 killed after friend rams bike into their two-wheeler in Mumbai
157.article_body: Two men, aged 21 and 22, were killed after their bike was rammed into by another bike being driven by their friend in Mumbai's Bandra (East), police said. The friend was booked for causing the deaths due to rash and negligent driving, police added. The deceased's bike hit a divider and they fell on a car coming from opposite end.

158.title: Apple MacBook shipments delayed amid China COVID-19 lockdowns
158.article_body: Apple MacBook buyers are facing a delay in the delivery of their orders amid China's COVID-19 lockdowns. US consumers trying to order Apple's latest high-end models are now seeing delivery estimates pushed into June, Bloomberg reported. Over 30 Taiwanese companies, including Apple laptop manufacturer Quanta Computer, have halted production in China because of lockdowns.

159.title: Tamil should be the link language of India: BJP leaders in TN
159.article_body: Days after Union Minister Amit Shah said that people from different states should communicate with each other in Hindi, BJP leaders in Tamil Nadu advocated Tamil to be made the link language of India. "Tamil could qualify as the link language of India and steps should be taken in this direction," said BJP leader and former Union Minister Pon Radhakrishnan.

160.title: Oscar-winning actor Cuba Gooding Jr pleads guilty to forcibly kissing waitress at a club
160.article_body: Oscar-winning actor Cuba Gooding Jr pleaded guilty to forcibly kissing a waitress at a New York nightclub in 2018. This comes nearly three years after the actor was arrested in the case. He was accused of assaulting three different women at various night spots in 2018-2019. His guilty plea is part of an agreement that spares him immediate jail time.

161.title: CBI makes first arrest in West Bengal Congress councillor murder case
161.article_body: Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) on Wednesday made its first arrest in connection with the murder of West Bengal Congress councillor Tapan Kandu. CBI arrested Satyaban Pramanik, an owner of a 'dhaba' who apparently had business dealings with Kandu, and a court sent him to CBI custody for four days. Notably, Kandu's brother is a suspect in the case.

162.title: Zomato delivery boy attacked, robbed of cash by 2 men in Pune
162.article_body: A Zomato delivery executive was allegedly attacked by a sharp weapon and robbed of his cash and other valuables worth ₹5,000 by two unidentified motorcycle-borne men in Pune on Tuesday. The incident happened when the 21-year-old had gone to the Balewadi area for delivery at around 2.20 am. "A probe is on to identify and arrest the robbers," police said.

163.title: As a new parent, I'll never impose my fears & desires on my child: Priyanka
163.article_body: Actress Priyanka Chopra, who welcomed a baby girl in January this year via surrogacy, spoke about what kind of a parent she wants to be for her daughter. She said, "As a new parent...I'll never be imposing my desires, fears, my upbringing onto my child." "There's no belief like this is my child and I'll shape everything," she added.

164.title: 13-yr-old girl dies after drowning in Sanjay Van lake in Delhi
164.article_body: A 13-year old girl reportedly died after drowning in the Sanjay Van lake in the Kishangarh area of Southwest Delhi on Wednesday. According to police, the deceased was sitting on the passageway over the lake when she suddenly slipped while playing and drowned. She was rescued and rushed to the hospital, where doctors declared her brought dead.

165.title: Brazil man, known as 'Human Satan', has his ears removed as masks no longer mandatory
165.article_body: A Brazilian body-modification addict known as 'Human Satan' has had his ears removed to celebrate the end of COVID-19 face mask rules. Michel Faro Praddo said he was just waiting for face masks to no longer be mandatory to perform the procedure. Praddo has undergone more than 60 procedures and has around 85% of his body covered in ink.

166.title: Let the rich teams stay at the bottom of IPL 2022 points table: Sehwag on MI, CSK
166.article_body: After MI suffered their fifth straight defeat, Virender Sehwag said, "Let the rich teams (MI and CSK) stay at the bottom of points table this season." Talking about MI's loss against PBKS, Sehwag stated, "It's difficult to win after two run-outs. I don't think...Suryakumar Yadav knew that the final over will be bowled by either Odean Smith or Liam Livingstone."

167.title: Ranbir is the junior version of Amitabh Bachchan: Actor's trainer
167.article_body: Ranbir Kapoor's trainer Shivoham said Ranbir is the junior version of Amitabh Bachchan when it comes to punctuality. "He has only cancelled a training session once or twice due to some work," added Shivoham. "It is amazing to see the person I am training, respects time so much," stated Shivoham. Ranbir, Amitabh will star together in the upcoming film 'Brahmastra'.

168.title: Saw videos of 700 affected families, couldn't speak: 'The Kashmir...' actor
168.article_body: Actor Darshan Kumaar who was recently seen in 'The Kashmir Files' said he couldn't speak a word after seeing videos showing the heart-wrenching stories of 700 families, who were victims. "We always talk about humanity and justice. Our film shows what happens when there is no humanity," added Darshan. Aamir Khan recently said every Indian must watch 'The Kashmir Files'.

169.title: Liverpool defeat Benfica, Man City beat Atletico to enter Champions League semis
169.article_body: Premier League sides Liverpool and Manchester City have entered the Champions League semifinals after playing out draws in their respective second legs of the quarterfinals. Manchester City, who had won the first leg 1-0, played out a goalless draw to eliminate Atletico Madrid. Liverpool, with a 3-1 win in first leg, drew 3-3 with Benfica to advance 6-4 on aggregate.

170.title: Russia says its warship in Black Sea 'badly damaged', Ukraine claims attack
170.article_body: A Russian warship in the Black Sea was "seriously damaged" as a result of the "detonation of ammunition caused by fire", Russia's Defence Ministry said. The Governor of the Odesa region in Ukraine claimed that Russia's Moskva missile cruiser was hit by two Ukrainian-made Neptune anti-ship cruise missiles. Last month, Ukraine said it had destroyed Russia's large landing ship, Orsk.

171.title: China's anti-corruption watchdog involved in Jack Ma's Ant probe: Report
171.article_body: China's anti-corruption watchdog CCDI was among the agencies involved in a recent inquiry into links between billionaire Jack Ma's Ant and state-owned Chinese companies, Bloomberg News reported. It sought to understand Ant's influence and the extent of its transactions with state banks and enterprises. It was also involved in questions sent to state firms about their exposure to Ant.

172.title: Pune man held for possessing brown sugar worth ₹28,000
172.article_body: A 34-year-old man was arrested by Pune City Police for possessing 5.64 grams of brown sugar worth ₹28,200. The accused, identified as Sanjay Mahadev Sathe, was arrested near the railway gate in the Wanwadi area after police found his movement suspicious. The police are now investigating to find out from where he procured the banned substance.

173.title: He doesn't praise my work easily, tells if he doesn't like it: Abhishek on Big B
173.article_body: Reacting to Amitabh Bachchan praising his performance in 'Dasvi', Abhishek Bachchan said Amitabh does not praise his work easily despite being his father, adding that he will tell if he doesn't like anything. "Earlier he...[would] worry that if he praises...people will say it's biased. But this time he said, 'You are my son...I will say what I feel'," stated Abhishek.

174.title: Ex-Army man found murdered in Bengaluru, probe underway
174.article_body: A 56-year-old ex-Army man was hammered to death at his house in Bengaluru's Goutham Colony. The deceased, Jude Suresh, was a divorcee and lived alone after the death of his mother three years ago. The house was in the name of Suresh's mother and his siblings used to come home frequently and fight over the property, the police said.

175.title: BJP govt doesn't calculate electoral benefits before public welfare: Piyush Goyal
175.article_body: Union Minister Piyush Goyal said the BJP government never calculates electoral benefits before public welfare.
