There is an environment of "pro-incumbency" in the country, unlike during the earlier regimes, Goyal added. "Welfare of the poor is our priority…People are happy with government’s welfare work and the recent results of the Assembly elections in several states indicate that," Goyal stated.

176.title: Illegal arms supplier held at Delhi airport, was trying to flee to Dubai
176.article_body: Ghaziabad police arrested a 45-year-old man for allegedly manufacturing and supplying illegal arms across western Uttar Pradesh. The accused, identified as Jahiruddin Raji, was trying to flee to Dubai and was apprehended at Indira Gandhi International (IGI) Airport in Delhi, police added. Raji had been in the arms manufacturing business for about a decade now, police said.

177.title: Violence during Ram Navami procession was pre-planned: Guj Police
177.article_body: Gujarat Police on Wednesday said that the violence during a Ram Navami procession in Khambhat, which left one dead, was a pre-planned conspiracy. "The Hindu community takes out processions and celebrates Ram Navami. With an aim to stop these celebrations and to increase the dominance of the Muslim community in the area, the procession was attacked," said police.

178.title: World's first-ever tweet's NFT, on sale for $48 mn, sees top bid of $280
178.article_body: An NFT of the world's first-ever tweet, being resold for $48 million, received a top bid of $280. Malaysia-based Sina Estavi purchased the NFT for $2.9 million in 2021. The auction for the NFT closed with only seven offers ranging from about $6-$280. "If I get a good offer, I might accept it, I might never sell it," Estavi said.

179.title: Complete Bharat Vandana Park work before Aug 15 next year: Delhi LG
179.article_body: Delhi Lieutenant Governor Anil Baijal on Wednesday reviewed the construction work of Bharat Vandana Park in Delhi's Dwarka. He also directed officials to complete the work before August 15 next year, so that it can be dedicated to the nation as part of 'Azadi ka Amrit Mahotsav'. According to officials, 40% of work on Bharat Vandana Park has been completed.

180.title: How have top-ranked T20I batters performed in IPL 2022 so far?
180.article_body: World number two T20I batter Aiden Markram, who represents SRH in IPL 2022, has scored 81 runs in three innings. CSK's Devon Conway, who is ranked fifth, has played one IPL 2022 match so far, scoring just three runs. RR's Jos Buttler, who is world number 17 T20I batter, is the leading run-scorer in IPL 2022 so far.

181.title: Woman from Zimbabwe held at Ahmedabad airport with heroin worth ₹42 cr
181.article_body: A woman, in possession of 5.96 kilograms of heroin worth ₹42 crore, was arrested at Ahmedabad's  Sardar Vallabhbhai Patel International Airport. The accused, from Zimbabwe, was apprehended after she arrived from Abu Dhabi, Directorate of Revenue Intelligence (DRI) officials said. "During the examination of her baggage, four plastic bags filled with brown powder substance were found," DRI stated.

182.title: 18-year-old Baby AB smashes 4 sixes in a row, video goes viral
182.article_body: Mumbai Indians (MI) batter Dewald Brevis, who is known as Baby AB, smashed four sixes in a row against PBKS leg-spinner Rahul Chahar in their IPL 2022 match on Wednesday. Brevis went on to smash a total of five sixes in the innings, becoming the youngest cricketer to smash five sixes in an innings in IPL.

183.title: Karnataka temple continues tradition of beginning festival with Quran recitation
183.article_body: Karnataka's Chennakeshava temple on Wednesday continued with its tradition of beginning the rathotsava (car festival) after reciting passages from the Quran. "Earlier, the temple administration issued a notice to Muslim shopkeepers urging them to close their shops. However, the government allowed them to take part...Accordingly, around 15 Muslim traders had set up their shops," an official said.

184.title: NPCI approves additional 6 crore UPI users for WhatsApp
184.article_body: The National Payments Corporation of India (NPCI) has approved an additional 6 crore users on UPI for WhatsApp. With this approval, WhatsApp will be able to expand the service to 10 crore users. The move comes months after NPCI approved increasing the user cap for WhatsApp's payment service from 2 crore to 4 crore.

185.title: 4 arrested for stealing BSNL cables in Chandigarh
185.article_body: Chandigarh Police arrested four persons for stealing BSNL wires multiple times from the UT in last six months. The accused used to unfasten the coverlid of the cable duckett during the daytime. They then stole the cables after cutting them during the night. The accused used an autorickshaw to carry the tools and take back the stolen wires.

186.title: No hate speech was given at Delhi Dharam Sansad: Delhi Police to SC
186.article_body: No hate speech was given at Delhi Dharam Sansad against the Muslim community, Delhi Police told the Supreme Court. "After investigation and evaluation of the purported video clip, it was concluded that the alleged speech contained no hate speech against a particular community," police added. "All the complaints filed regarding the event are closed," Delhi Police further said.

187.title: Hundreds of earthquakes recorded near volcano that hasn't erupted for 800 yrs in Alaska
187.article_body: Hundreds of earthquakes have been reported near Mount Edgecumbe, a volcano in southeast Alaska, believed to have been dormant for at least 800 years. The cause of the quakes are not known. They may not be an indication of volcanic activity, said Dave Schneider, a research geophysicist with the US Geological Survey at the Alaska Volcano Observatory in Anchorage.

188.title: Wishing you both love, luck and light: Big B on Ranbir and Alia's wedding
188.article_body: Amitabh Bachchan took to Instagram on Wednesday to wish Alia Bhatt and Ranbir Kapoor as they began their pre-wedding functions. The veteran actor, who's sharing screen space with Alia and Ranbir in 'Brahmastra', shared the 'Kesariya' video from the film. He captioned it, "Wishing our Isha and Shiva...love, luck and light as they gear up to embark on a...special journey."

189.title: 2 armed men rob money exchanger of ₹60,000 at gunpoint in Ludhiana
189.article_body: Two armed robbers took away ₹60,000 cash from a money exchanger at gunpoint in Ludhiana, police said. The complainant told police that the accused entered his office while he was counting cash. One of them pointed a gun at him, and the other took out cash from the cabinet, following which they fled the scene, he added.

190.title: Huge change in approach to disaster management after 2014: Amit Shah
190.article_body: There has been a huge change in the approach to disaster management in the country after 2014, Union Home Minister Amit Shah said. His remarks came while interacting with the Jharkhand ropeway accident rescue operation personnel. "Before 2014, there was only a relief-based approach, after Modiji became PM, the approach of saving human lives came in disaster management," Shah added.

191.title: Mayank is backing me 100%: Odean on bowling final over vs MI after GT game
191.article_body: After defending 22 runs in the final over against MI, PBKS all-rounder Odean Smith said captain Mayank Agarwal's backing has been very motivating for him. Notably, Odean had failed to defend 19 runs in their game against GT. "Coach and captain...helped me mentally to be able to come into this game [against MI] and put in the performance," he stated.

192.title: COVID-19 pandemic pushed 7.7 cr people into poverty in 2021: UN
192.article_body: The United Nations in a report said that about 7.7 crore people around the world slipped into poverty in 2021 owing to the economic impact of the COVID-19 pandemic. It said that while the rich countries managed to avoid the worst consequences, the poorer ones failed to secure early vaccine access and continue to reel under debt.

193.title: Centre should have objected to US' remark on 'rights abuses' in India: Pawar
193.article_body: NCP chief Sharad Pawar said the Centre should have raised objection to US Secretary of State Antony Blinken's "we are monitoring rise in human rights abuses in India" remark. "Defence Minister Rajnath Singh and EAM S Jaishankar were present there, they should've commented," Pawar added. The statement made by the US is "detrimental" for the country, Pawar further said.

194.title: Police arrest 4 for betting on IPL matches in Bengaluru, seize ₹5 lakh
194.article_body: The Central Crime Branch (CCB) of Bengaluru Police have arrested four people for betting on Indian Premier League (IPL) matches in separate cases. About ₹5 lakh cash and four mobile phones have been seized from them. Three accused were arrested by the CCB in Mahalaksmi Layout Police Station limits and a fourth person was apprehended in Basavanagudi Police Station limits.

195.title: Fame Forever introduces new campaign ‘Wear it. Pair it. Anywhere it.’
195.article_body: Lifestyle's brand Fame Forever introduced the campaign 'Wear it. Pair it. Anywhere it.' The campaign seeks to highlight the idea of versatility by showcasing different style preferences fulfilling each individual's requirement. Its women's collection has denim and tops, men's wear has polos and knitted shorts, and the kids' collection has summer dresses, shorts and tees, starting from ₹249.

196.title: India reports 1,007 new COVID-19 cases, 1 death in last 24 hours
196.article_body: India has reported 1,007 new COVID-19 cases, 818 recoveries and one death in the state of Maharashtra in the last 24 hours, according to the Union Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. It comes a day after the country reported 1,088 COVID-19 cases and 26 deaths. India's active caseload currently stands at 11,058, while the death toll reached 5,21,737.

197.title: Iceland Cricket name Virat Kohli as 12th man of India's best-ever Test XI, fans react
197.article_body: Iceland Cricket took to Twitter to name India's best-ever Test XI and included Virat Kohli as the 12th man. Reacting to it, a fan wrote, "I think you have zero knowledge of Test cricket." Another wrote, "Do you know that India has won the most Test matches under Kohli's captaincy?" Another tweeted, "Are you kidding me?"

198.title: US approves additional $800 million military aid for Ukraine
198.article_body: US President Joe Biden has approved an additional $800 million package of military assistance for Ukraine amid the Russian offensive. The package includes helicopters, artillery, armoured vehicles and protective gear for soldiers in case of a chemical or a nuclear attack. Biden said that the US anticipates a wider assault by Russia in eastern Ukraine.

199.title: Tesla racism case award to ex-US worker cut to $15 mn from $137 mn
199.article_body: A US judge has cut the award for Tesla’s racism case, involving a former Black worker Owen Diaz, to $15 million from a staggering $137 million. The judge said Tesla is liable to Diaz who said the firm ignored racial abuse at the factory where he worked. A lawyer for Diaz said he plans to appeal the lowered damages award.

200.title: Avoid travelling on Kunzum Pass highway as road not restored: Lahaul-Spiti DC
200.article_body: The deputy commissioner of Lahaul-Spiti has advised tourists and locals to avoid travelling through the Kaza-Losar-Gramphu-Koksar highway (Kunzum Pass highway) as the road has not been restored yet. He added that the work to restore the road is underway at a fast pace. Tourists and locals will be allowed to travel through the route only after its inspection, he said.

201.title: I hope Amber's corpse is decomposing in a car: Johnny Depp in text to friend
201.article_body: Actor Johnny Depp wrote in a text to his best friend he hoped Amber Heard's "corpse is decomposing in the trunk" of a car, the jury in his defamation trial against his ex-wife heard on Wednesday. Depp's friend Isaac Baruch was questioned over the messages as a witness. Depp has sued Heard over an op-ed she wrote in 2018.

202.title: At one point, we were cruising, I thought PBKS' 198 was chaseable: Rohit
202.article_body: Speaking at the post-match presentation ceremony after their 12-run defeat against PBKS, MI captain Rohit Sharma said they came pretty close but didn't hold their nerves to win the game. "At one time, we were cruising...and I thought 198 was chaseable...[but] a couple of run-outs didn't help our cause," he added. PBKS posted 198/5 and then restricted MI to 186/9.

203.title: Failing to give reason for son's death, Mumbai woman gets life imprisonment
203.article_body: A 30-year-old woman was given life imprisonment by a Mumbai court for killing her six-year-old son. Throughout the trial, the woman did not explain the circumstances surrounding the unnatural death of her son. The woman used to live with her son in a room shared with another woman and had allegedly killed her son when the roommate left for work.

204.title: CNG price hiked by ₹2.5 per kg in Delhi, PNG by ₹4.25 per SCM
204.article_body: Indraprastha Gas Limited (IGL) on Thursday hiked the Compressed Natural Gas (CNG) price in Delhi by ₹2.5 per kg to ₹71.61 per kg. IGL has also increased the price of Piped Natural Gas (PNG) by ₹4.25 per standard cubic metre (SCM) to ₹45.86 per SCM. CNG price in Noida, Greater Noida and Ghaziabad has been hiked to ₹74.17 per kg.

205.title: Suryakumar might have been under pressure thinking he caused run-outs: Sehwag
205.article_body: Ex-India batter Virender Sehwag has said Suryakumar Yadav, who got out when MI needed 22 off 9 balls against PBKS, might have felt the pressure thinking about the run-outs he was involved in during their innings. "Sometimes...if you affect a runout, you go back into a shell," Sehwag added. Suryakumar was involved in run-outs of Tilak Varma and Kieron Pollard.

206.title: Engineering student stabbed to death in Meerut college; 5 detained
206.article_body: A B.Tech student of Meerut Institute of Engineering and Technology (MIET) was allegedly stabbed to death by a group of students on Wednesday. According to police, it appeared to be an altercation between two groups in the college. "The rival group members stabbed Nikhil Choudhary to death," said police. Five students have been detained for questioning.

207.title: Thiruvananthapuram airport runway to be closed for 5 hours on Apr 15
207.article_body: The runway at Thiruvananthapuram International Airport will be closed from 4 pm to 9 pm on April 15 to facilitate Arattu procession of Sree Padmanabhaswamy Temple. The domestic and international operations during this period have been rescheduled. The airport will also organise several competitions for passengers on April 13 and 14 as a part of the Tamil new year celebrations.

208.title: Rishi's wishes are coming true: Rakesh Roshan on Alia, Ranbir's wedding
208.article_body: Speaking about Ranbir Kapoor and Alia Bhatt's wedding, late actor Rishi Kapoor's friend, Rakesh Roshan said, "All my blessings and good wishes are with Ranbir and Alia. Rishi's wishes are coming true." According to reports, Ranbir and Alia will tie the knot on April 14. The Haldi ceremony will reportedly begin at morning 9 am, followed by the chooda ceremony.

209.title: Mumbai woman tries to stop man who snatched her phone, falls off local train
209.article_body: A 49-year-old woman, while trying to stop a robber who stole her mobile phone, fell off a running local train in Mumbai. The incident took place at Mahim railway station. The accused  was standing on the platform and as the train started he got into the women’s compartment and snatched her phone. The victim is admitted in a government hospital.

210.title: 6 killed, 13 injured in massive fire at chemical factory in Andhra's Eluru
210.article_body: At least six people were killed and 13 got injured after a massive fire broke out at a chemical factory in Akkireddigudem in Andhra Pradesh's Eluru. "The fire broke out due to leakage of nitric acid and monomethyl," Eluru SP said. Andhra Pradesh CM YS Jagan Mohan Reddy has announced ex-gratia of ₹25 lakh to the families of the deceased.

211.title: Man involved in 7 house break-ins held in Pune, gold ornaments recovered
211.article_body: Pune police's Crime Branch arrested a 21-year-old man in connection with at least seven house break-ins in the city. Police have recovered gold ornaments and cash worth ₹5 lakh from his possession. Police Inspector Ganesh Mane of Crime Branch said besides the accused, his maternal aunt is also involved in the thefts and a hunt is on to arrest her.

212.title: 62-year-old man arrested for shooting 10 at New York subway
212.article_body: Police in New York City have arrested a 62-year-old man suspected of shooting 10 commuters at a Brooklyn subway station. Officials said Frank James was the sole suspect in the shooting, in which 23 people were wounded. James sent off smoke grenades in a crowded subway car and then fired at least 33 shots with a handgun, police said.

213.title: Pune's SPPU signs MoU to allow students from US to study Indian culture
213.article_body: Savitribai Phule Pune University (SPPU) has signed an MoU with The American Institute of Indian Studies, an international centre of Pune University, to allow students in US to study Indian culture, language and civic life. As part of the agreement, students' expenses will be borne by the institute. Further, affiliation fees, travel expenses and other facilities will also be provided.

214.title: Teacher suspended for preaching Christianity in Tamil Nadu school
214.article_body: A teacher was suspended for allegedly preaching Christianity to students in a government school in Tamil Nadu's Kanniyakumari. According to officials, the students alleged that the teacher portrayed Hinduism in a bad light. In a video, one of the students said, "She asked us to read the Bible…She said Gita is bad and the Bible is the truth."

215.title: Man accused of killing his 2 kids jumps from B'luru court building, dies
215.article_body: A murder accused has died after he allegedly jumped from the fifth floor of a civil court building in Bengaluru on Wednesday afternoon. The incident took place when the accused, Jithin Kumar, was brought to the court for a hearing. The 34-year-old was arrested in 2020 for allegedly killing his two minor children over a domestic row with his wife.

216.title: 2.6 kg opium worth ₹26 lakh seized in Hyd from ice-cream seller, held
216.article_body: Police in Hyderabad arrested an inter-state drug peddler, who used to work as an ice-cream seller, for transporting opium from Rajasthan to Hyderabad. They seized 2.6 kilograms of opium worth ₹26 lakh, ₹10,000 in cash and a mobile phone. "The accused during his visit to Rajasthan was purchasing opium from a truck driver...bringing it to the city," Rachakonda Police said.

217.title: Rohit Sharma fined ₹24 lakh, highest penalty for slow over-rate in IPL 2022 so far
217.article_body: MI captain Rohit Sharma has been fined ₹24 lakh after his team maintained a slow over-rate against PBKS. It's the highest fine for a slow over-rate offence in IPL 2022 so far. It was MI's second such offence of the season. Remaining members in MI's playing XI were fined ₹6 lakh or 25% of their match fee, whichever is lower.

218.title: Kieron Pollard consoles Suryakumar Yadav after getting run-out, video goes viral
218.article_body: A video of all-rounder Kieron Pollard consoling Suryakumar Yadav after getting run-out following a mix-up during Mumbai Indians' 17th over against Punjab Kings has gone viral. Pollard got run-out while running for a second after a slight misfield from Odean Smith despite initially declining Suryakumar's call for the second run. Pollard was dismissed for 10(11).

219.title: India responds after US' human rights remark, says 'We too have views about US'
219.article_body: After US said it was monitoring a "rise in human rights abuses by some Indian government, police and prison officials", External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar said, "I'd tell you that we also take our views on other people's human rights situation, including that of US. So, we take up human rights issues when they arise in this country," he added.

220.title: Russian Netflix users sue firm for leaving, demand $726,000: Report
220.article_body: Russian users of Netflix have sued the firm for leaving the Russian market, demanding $726,000 in compensation, the RIA news agency reported. "The reason for the lawsuit was a violation of Russian users' rights due to Netflix's unilateral refusal to provide services in Russia," RIA cited a law firm as saying. Netflix suspended its services in Russia in March.

221.title: Man falls off 4th floor while hanging wind chime in Gurugram, dies
221.article_body: A 79-year-old man, a retired pilot, died after allegedly falling off the balcony on the fourth floor in a residential society in Gurugram, police said. The victim was hanging a wind chime on the balcony, police added. "He had one foot on a ladder and another on the ledge and is suspected to have slipped after losing balance," police stated.

222.title: Man's shirt catches fire as birthday cake candle bursts in Mumbai, pic surfaces
222.article_body: A sparkling candle on a cake burst during a birthday celebration in Mumbai's Ambernath, injuring a man. The man was trying to blow the candle before cutting the cake, while his friends threw wheat flour and eggs on him to prank him. The candle suddenly burst and the man's shirt caught fire.

223.title: MI equal their worst start to an IPL season as PBKS hand them their 5th straight loss
223.article_body: PBKS defeated MI by 12 runs in their IPL 2022 clash in Pune. PBKS handed MI their fifth straight defeat in IPL 2022. With this, MI equalled their worst start to an IPL season. They had lost their first five matches of an IPL season in IPL 2014 as well. PBKS opener Shikhar Dhawan top-scored in the match with 70(50).

224.title: New Zealand welcomes Australian visitors after reopening border
224.article_body: New Zealand on Wednesday welcomed Australian tourists and permanent residents after opening its borders for the first time in nearly two years. "It is more than just economic for us, it's a big part of who we are to be welcoming to people," Prime Minister Jacinda Ardern said. New Zealand has reported 497 COVID-19 deaths so far.

225.title: Greece to lift COVID-19 measures ahead of summer tourism season
225.article_body: Greece on Wednesday said most COVID-19 measures such as mask-wearing indoors and vaccination certificates will be lifted throughout the summer tourism season. Wearing masks indoors will no longer be required from June 1 and from May 1 to August 31 people will no longer require vaccination certificates to enter public spaces. Greece on Tuesday reported 15,000 cases and 64 deaths.

226.title: Former Italian PM Berlusconi denounces Putin over Ukraine war
226.article_body: Former Italian Prime Minister Silvio Berlusconi denounced Russian President Vladimir Putin over Russia's invasion of Ukraine. "I cannot and do not want to hide the fact that I am deeply disappointed and saddened by the behaviour of Vladimir Putin," Berlusconi said. "It [Russia] should, for its own interests, identify and put the perpetrators on trial," he added.

227.title: US city of Philadelphia to reintroduce indoor mask mandate
227.article_body: The US city of Philadelphia will reintroduce an indoor mask mandate for public spaces as COVID-19 cases rise. Philadelphia will be the first major US city to reintroduce the measure when it takes effect on April 18. "This looks like we may be at the start of a new COVID wave, like Europe just saw," Health Commissioner Cheryl Bettigole said.

228.title: 18-year-old Baby AB smashes biggest six of IPL 2022
228.article_body: MI's 18-year-old batter Dewald Brevis, who is known as Baby AB, smashed a 112-metre maximum to record the biggest six of IPL 2022 so far. He hit the six on the bowling of PBKS leg-spinner Rahul Chahar. It was the last of his four consecutive sixes during MI's ninth over. Brevis slammed a total of five sixes in his knock.

229.title: Which 7 batters have scored 10,000 runs in T20 cricket?
229.article_body: MI captain Rohit Sharma today became the seventh batter to reach 10,000 runs in T20 cricket. He is the second Indian after Virat Kohli to achieve the feat. Chris Gayle has scored the most runs (14,562) in T20 cricket. Gayle is followed by Shoaib Malik (11,698), Kieron Pollard (11,474), Aaron Finch (10,499), Kohli (10,379) and David Warner (10,373).

230.title: Geomagnetic storm likely to hit Earth on April 14 and 15
230.article_body: A huge amount of plasma heading towards Earth from the Sun is expected to hit the planet by Thursday. "G2 (Moderate) and G1 (Minor) geomagnetic storm watches are in effect for 14 and 15 April," tweeted Space Weather Prediction Center of National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration. The Sun is experiencing increase in solar activity as part of its solar cycle.

231.title: Import of cotton fully exempted from customs duties till September 30
231.article_body: The government has exempted all cotton imports from customs duties from April 14 to September 30, 2022. Currently, cotton imports attract 5% Basic Customs Duty (BCD) and 5% Agriculture Infrastructure Development Cess (AIDC). "This exemption shall benefit the textile chain - yarn, fabric, garments, and provide relief to consumers," the Finance Ministry said.

232.title: 'Dhaakad' actress Kangana reacts to being compared to Charlize Theron
232.article_body: Kangana Ranaut has reacted to American YouTuber Jaby Koay's comment on her 'Dhaakad' teaser. Jaby said Kangana's presence in 'Dhaakad' "looks stronger" than what Charlize Theron did in 'Atomic Blonde'. Taking to Instagram Stories, Kangana wrote, "Wow, thanks Jaby." In another Instagram Story, she wrote, "Today to be called better than...best action star in the world is a big compliment."

233.title: At least 45 dead as heavy floods affect Durban area in South Africa
233.article_body: Officials on Tuesday said heavy rains and flooding in the KwaZulu-Natal province of Durban in South Africa have killed at least 45 people so far. South Africa has deployed its military to Durban and the surrounding area to assist in rescue operations. "There are still cases of collapsed buildings where operations are still continuing," emergency services spokesman Robert McKenzie said.

234.title: Over 27% of German population have a migrant background: Survey
234.article_body: A new survey published by Germany's statistics agency Destatis found people with a migrant background make up over 27% of Germany's population. From around 82 million people living in the country, an estimated 22.3 million are foreign-born or people with foreign roots. Turkey is the largest point of origin with 12%, followed by Poland with 10% and Russia with 6%.

235.title: Infosys has a three-phase plan for employees to return to office: CFO
235.article_body: Infosys CFO Nilanjan Roy explained employees' three-phased return to work plan, saying, "In the first phase, we're encouraging people in their home locations...in the DCs (Development Centres) where they are...to come at least twice a week." He said, "Phase two is encouraging people outside DC towns to make preparations for return." He called "looking at hybrid work" the third phase.

236.title: Video appears to show Russian tanks blowing up own soldiers at point blank in Ukraine
236.article_body: A video appearing to show Russian tanks firing point blank at their own soldiers is being widely shared on social media. The video was captured by a Ukrainian surveillance drone near the village of Dmytrivka near the capital Kyiv on March 31. The incident took place just before the Russian troops started pulling out from the Ukrainian capital.

237.title: Rohit Sharma reaches 10,000-run mark in T20 cricket with a six
237.article_body: Mumbai Indians (MI) captain Rohit Sharma on Wednesday completed 10,000 runs in T20 cricket, reaching the milestone with a six on the bowling of PBKS fast bowler Kagiso Rabada. Rohit, who needed 25 runs to reach the 10,000-run mark ahead of the match, got out for 28(17). He is the second Indian batter after Virat Kohli to reach the milestone.

238.title: Whether you like it or not, farm laws will come back: BJP MP
238.article_body: BJP MP from Rajya Sabha Suresh Gopi on Wednesday claimed the three farm laws, which were repealed by the Centre, will come back. "I am a BJP man...am extremely angry over the withdrawal of the farm laws...Whether you like it or not...the farm laws will come back," he said. The government rolled back the laws after continuous protests by farmers.

239.title: Warner Bros defend cutting 'Fantastic Beasts 3' dialogue on gay romance in China
239.article_body: A six-second dialogue with a reference to a gay relationship in 'Fantastic Beasts: Secrets of Dumbledore' has been removed by Warner Bros at China's request ahead of the film's release in the country. "Warner Bros accepted those changes to comply with local requirements but the spirit of the film remains intact," the company said in a statement released to Variety.

240.title: In a league of their own: Red Bull team boss Horner on Ferrari
240.article_body: Red Bull team boss Christian Horner said Ferrari were "in a league of their own" after Ferrari's Charles Leclerc won the Australian Grand Prix on Sunday. Red Bull's Max Verstappen suffered his second retirement of the season in Melbourne. "That was a really disappointing result not to finish the race," Horner said. Leclerc leads the driver standings with 71 points.

241.title: Former world no. 3 Thiem accepts wild card for Estoril Open in Portugal
241.article_body: Former world number three Dominic Thiem has accepted a wild card for the ATP 250 event Estoril Open in Portugal. The tournament will take place from April 25 to May 1. "I've heard great things about the event and I am looking forward to coming to Portugal to play and start my comeback," Thiem said on social media.

242.title: Korda beats world no. 11 Alcaraz to reach Monte Carlo Masters last 16
242.article_body: Sebastian Korda on Wednesday beat world number 11 Carlos Alcaraz 7-6(2), 6-7(5), 6-3 to reach the last 16 of the ATP Masters 1000 tournament in Monte Carlo. "It was super tough to serve today but I'm super happy with the way I handled myself," Korda said. The 21-year-old will face either Taylor Fritz or Marin Cilic in the next round.

243.title: Elderly couple reconciles by sharing sweets at UP police station
243.article_body: A 75-year-old man and his wife, who had been living separately, made peace at a police station in UP's Gonda, police said on Monday. Police called the duo to the station and helped them reach a settlement, after which they agreed to live together. A video from the incident shows the couple feeding each other sweets.

244.title: France Prez refuses to call Russian invasion of Ukraine a 'genocide'
244.article_body: France's President Emmanuel Macron on Wednesday refused to term the Russian invasion of Ukraine a 'genocide', stating that he would rather be "discreet" while using such terms. "Russians and Ukrainians are fraternal peoples. What is happening is madness...I want to try...to...restore peace," he added. Macron's comments come after US President Joe Biden described the invasion as a "genocide".

245.title: 2 NCB officers, who probed Aryan Khan drugs case, suspended over 'suspicious activities'
245.article_body: The Narcotics Control Bureau (NCB) on Wednesday suspended two of its officers probing the cruise ship drugs case involving Shah Rukh Khan's son Aryan Khan. They have been suspended for allegedly indulging in 'suspicious activities', said India Today. It is not yet clear whether they have been suspended for their role in the cruise drugs case.

246.title: CBI books textiles major S Kumars in ₹1,245 crore loan fraud case
246.article_body: CBI has booked textiles major S Kumars Nationwide Limited and 14 others, including its promoters and directors, for an alleged bank fraud worth ₹1,245 crore. CBI had on Wednesday searched 13 locations related to the accused and recovered "incriminating documents", CBI spokesperson RC Joshi said. He added that promoters and directors allegedly misused bank consortium's funds between 2012 and 2018.

247.title: Andhra govt's diversion of disaster funds 'serious' matter: SC
247.article_body: The Supreme Court on Wednesday said that the Andhra Pradesh government's decision of diverting ₹1100 crore from the State Disaster Response Fund (SDRF) to finance the state's subsidy scheme for farmers was a "serious" matter. "The money meant for disaster relief cannot be used for any other purpose," a bench of Justices MR Shah and BV Nagarathna remarked.

248.title: NCB suspends probe in-charge, intel officer in Aryan Khan drugs case
248.article_body: The Narcotics Control Bureau (NCB) has suspended the probe in-charge and intel officer probing the drugs case involving Aryan Khan for negligence, reports said. Aryan Khan was named as an accused in the case along with 19 others by the NCB. The accused persons were booked under relevant sections of the Narcotic Drugs and Psychotropic Substances (NDPS) Act.

249.title: Adani Green Energy becomes India's 8th most valuable company
249.article_body: Adani Green Energy has jumped two spots to become India's eighth most valued firm with a market valuation of ₹4.48 lakh crore. The company, which entered the list of top-10 valued firms on Monday, overtook Bajaj Finance and HDFC Ltd on Wednesday. Reliance Industries is India's most valued firm, followed by TCS, HDFC Bank, Infosys, ICICI Bank, HUL and SBI.

250.title: Don't wish to seek validation of my work basis on some list: Yami
250.article_body: Yami Gautam has said, "I don't wish to seek validation of my work, of my existence in this industry basis on some list." Yami added she believes that work should be done the right way. Recently, Yami called a critic's review of her performance in 'Dasvi' "extremely disrespectful" on Twitter. "There's only so much you can do as...actor," she added.

251.title: 18 people killed after overloaded truck rams into cliff in Indonesia
251.article_body: At least 18 people were killed after an overloaded truck carrying 29 people rammed into a cliff and flipped over in Indonesia's West Papua province on Wednesday. The truck, carrying miners and their families, was en route to the province's capital Manokwari. Survivors said that the truck's engine lost power while going up the hill and rolled backward before crashing.

252.title: St Stephen's in DU to give 85% weightage to CUET score for admission
252.article_body: St Stephen's College of Delhi University has decided to give 85% weightage of CUET scores and 15% of the interview marks for all categories of applicants. DU Vice-chancellor Yogesh Singh had recently directed colleges to solely consider Common University Entrance Test (CUET) scores for general seats. A DU official said they are trying to sort it out with St Stephen's.

253.title: Mercedes are in a ‘better state’ after Aus GP: Mercedes team boss Wolff
253.article_body: Team boss Toto Wolff said Mercedes are in a "better state" after the Australian Grand Prix on Sunday. "Clearly we haven't got the pace yet to challenge Ferrari and Red Bull but we know where we need to seek performance," Wolff said. Mercedes' George Russell finished third while teammate Lewis Hamilton finished fourth in the Australian Grand Prix in Melbourne.

254.title: Rishi Kapoor's scoldings had lot of love: 'Sharmaji...' actor Taaruk
254.article_body: Actor Taaruk Raina, who played Rishi Kapoor's son in the film 'Sharmaji Namkeen', has said that the late actor would get angry or upset during the film's shoot, scold them and then forget. "All of us have been scolded by him. But 'unki daant mein bohot pyar tha' (his scoldings had a lot of love in it)," the actor added.

255.title: Ukraine is a 'crime scene': ICC Chief Prosecutor after visiting Bucha
255.article_body: International Criminal Court's (ICC) Chief Prosecutor Karim Khan described Ukraine as a "crime scene" after visiting Bucha on Wednesday. Khan's comments came as an ICC team visited Ukraine to probe allegations of war crimes amid the Russian invasion. Bodies of 403 people have been recovered from Bucha so far, following a retreat by Russian troops, Bucha's Mayor Anatoliy Fedoruk said.

256.title: World no. 5 Tsitsipas beat Fognini to reach Monte Carlo Masters last 16
256.article_body: World number five Stefanos Tsitsipas on Tuesday beat Fabio Fognini 6-3, 6-0 to reach the round of 16 of the ATP Masters 1000 tournament in Monte Carlo. "Great things out there. I was able to really perform close to my best and deliver the result that I did," Tsitsipas said. Tsitsipas will face either Lorenzo Sonego or Laslo Djere next.

257.title: Stop matching single men with lone female Ukrainian refugees: UN to UK
257.article_body: The UN's refugee agency UN High Commissioner for Refugees has said that the UK government must intervene to stop matching single British men with lone Ukrainian women and children escaping the war amid fears of sexual exploitation. UNHCR has called for a "more appropriate matching process" for those who want to offer a shelter for the refugees.

258.title: BJP troubled by unity in Raj, trying to create communal tension: Gehlot
258.article_body: Rajasthan Chief Minister Ashok Gehlot on Wednesday alleged that BJP was troubled by the unity in the state and was trying to create communal tensions. If any person tries to disturb peace in Rajasthan, strict action will be taken against them, Gehlot said, on a day BJP MP Tejasvi Surya and other BJP leaders were stopped from visiting Karauli.

259.title: Virat Kohli catches up with Mukesh Choudhary after getting out to him, CSK share pic
259.article_body: RCB batter Virat Kohli met CSK fast bowler Mukesh Choudhary after getting out to him in their IPL 2022 clash on Tuesday. Sharing a picture of the duo on Instagram, CSK wrote, "Catching up after the match up at the middle." Kohli was dismissed for one run off three deliveries as RCB lost to CSK by 23 runs.

260.title: Man Utd close to signing Ajax's Ten Hag as next manager: Reports
260.article_body: Manchester United are reportedly close to signing Ajax manager Erik ten Hag as their new manager. Ten Hag has emerged as the preferred choice for Manchester United after a round of preliminary interviews. Ten Hag, 52, is set to become the fifth permanent manager to take over the club since Sir Alex Ferguson retired in 2013.

261.title: We're sad that some lives couldn't be saved: PM on J'khand ropeway accident
261.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Wednesday spoke to personnel who carried out rescue operation in Jharkhand's Deoghar where three people died in cable car accident. PM Modi said, "We are saddened that we could not save some people...I pray for speedy recovery of those injured." Praising the security personnel, he said, "Over the course of three days, you...completed a difficult operation."

262.title: Man's shirt catches fire as birthday cake candle bursts in Mumbai, pic surfaces
262.article_body: A sparkling candle on a cake burst during a birthday celebration in Mumbai's Ambernath, injuring a man. The man was trying to blow up the candle before cutting the cake, while his friends threw wheat flour and eggs on him to prank him. The candle suddenly burst and the man's shirt caught fire.

263.title: Same-sex marriage is against Indian culture, laws: UP govt to HC
263.article_body: Uttar Pradesh Government told Allahabad High Court that recognising same-sex marriage would be against Indian culture, laws and Indic religions. "As per the Indian law and culture, a biological husband and biological wife [are] essential for marriage...In their absence, homosexual marriage cannot be recognised as it lacks male and female, and neither can they produce children," it stated.

264.title: Hindu mahant who threatened to rape Muslim women arrested in UP
264.article_body: Hindu mahant Bajrang Muni Das, who had allegedly threatened to rape Muslim women, has been arrested, Sitapur SP RP Singh said on Wednesday. "He'll be presented in the court soon," he added. "If you harass one Hindu woman, then I will openly abduct your sisters and daughters and rape them," Das said earlier. Later, he claimed the video was distorted.

265.title: My last few days as bachelor, happy they're finally ending: Millind
265.article_body: Ahead of his wedding with Pria Beniwal, singer Millind Gaba has said, "These are my last few days as a bachelor. I'm happy they're finally ending, I'll have someone to look after me." Millind further said that marriage is a new chapter in his life. "I've known Pria for four years now, so the understanding, compatibility, chemistry...is there," he added.

266.title: 5 chimpanzees rescued in Assam; 2 suspected traffickers arrested
266.article_body: As many as five chimpanzees have been rescued from a vehicle and two suspected traffickers arrested in Assam's Karbi Anglong district, police said on Wednesday. Police intercepted the vehicle during a routine check near the Assam-Nagaland border on the previous night and found the animals inside. The animals have been handed over to the forest officials in the district.

267.title: 'Ranbir-Alia's wedding is tomorrow,' confirm Riddhima, Neetu
267.article_body: Actor Ranbir Kapoor's mother Neetu Kapoor and sister Riddhima Kapoor Sahni on Wednesday confirmed to the paparazzi that the actor and Alia Bhatt will marry on April 14. "Kal shaadi hai (Tomorrow is the wedding)," Riddhima said when the paparazzi asked for a confirmation on the wedding date. Neetu said the wedding will take place at Vastu, Ranbir's Mumbai residence.

268.title: Don't view expenditure on armed forces as burden on economy: Army Chief
268.article_body: Expenditure made on armed forces should not be viewed as a burden on the country's economy, said Chief of Army Staff General Manoj Mukund Naravane on Wednesday. "For a country to prosper, you need a stable and peaceful environment. That will happen only if you have strong-armed forces that will secure your borders," he said.

269.title: He penetrated me with liquor bottle: Amber Heard as she accuses Depp of sexual assault
269.article_body: Johnny Depp allegedly "penetrated Amber Heard with an alcohol bottle", his ex-wife's lawyer told court during Depp's defamation trial. "He has her jammed up against the bar. He has hurled bottles...at her. He has dragged her across the floor...And then, he penetrates her with a liquor bottle," the lawyer said. Depp's spokesperson denied the claims.

270.title: Delhi's COVID-19 tally rises by 50% in 24 hrs with 299 fresh cases
270.article_body: Delhi on Wednesday reported 299 fresh COVID-19 cases, a nearly 50% rise in new infections since Tuesday when the national capital logged 202 cases. As per the health bulletin, the positivity rate stands at 2.49% but no deaths were reported in the last 24 hours. Over 12,000 tests were conducted and 173 patients were discharged or recovered.

271.title: Firms must recall batches of EVs that caught fire: NITI Aayog CEO
271.article_body: NITI Aayog CEO Amitabh Kant on Wednesday said original equipment manufacturers should voluntarily recall batches of electric vehicles (EVs) involved in the recent fire accidents. Kant said the move will help in creating a sense of confidence among consumers. Adding that every transition has had its own challenges, Kant said "there's nothing to panic about" regarding the safety of EVs.

272.title: Cong exits Akbar Road office, whose rent was unpaid since '13: Reports
272.article_body: Congress on Tuesday started shifting its Sewa Dal office from 26, Akbar Road in New Delhi weeks after an RTI reply revealed that its monthly rent was unpaid since 2013, claimed reports. A senior Congress leader claimed that new rooms are being constructed at the party's headquarters at 24, Akbar Road to make space for the Sewa Dal office.

273.title: Monitor lizard gangraped in Maharashtra, video found on accused men's phone
273.article_body: Four men have been arrested for allegedly gangraping a Bengal monitor lizard in the Sahyadri Tiger Reserve in Maharashtra. The officials of the Maharashtra Forest Department said that they found a video of the act on the accused's phone. The accused will be produced in a court and appropriate legal action will be taken against them, officials said.

274.title: Centre should have objected to Blinken's remarks on rights abuses: Pawar
274.article_body: Nationalist Congress Party (NCP) supremo Sharad Pawar said on Wednesday that Centre should have objected to US Secretary of State Antony Blinken's remarks on 'rise in rights abuses' in India. "[This] statement made by...US in front of our ministers...is detrimental for [India]," he added. Blinken said on Tuesday that US was monitoring "concerning developments", including rights abuses in India.

275.title: Time to speak on inflation, unemployment: Pawar on loudspeaker remark
275.article_body: Responding to MNS chief Raj Thackeray's comment on the removal of loudspeakers from mosques, Nationalist Congress Party chief Sharad Pawar said it's time to speak on "inflation and unemployment, but no one speaks on it". Raj Thackeray on Tuesday warned of state wide protests if the state government failed to remove loudspeakers from mosques by May 3.

276.title: Guidelines to pursue 2 full-time degrees at the same time released by UGC
276.article_body: The University Grants Commission has released the guidelines for students who want to pursue two full-time UG or PG academic programmes simultaneously. The guidelines state that the students can pursue the two programmes in physical mode if their classes don't overlap or they can pursue one of them in online or open and distance learning mode.

277.title: US mother uses iPhone feature to track car stolen with 9-yr-old son inside it
277.article_body: A US mother helped police locate her car, which was stolen with her nine-year-old son inside, using Apple's 'Find My iPhone' feature. "With the assistance of the victim, officers used 'my location' technology on the child's iPhone and began canvassing the immediate area," police said. The car was located, the suspect was arrested and the child appeared to be uninjured.

278.title: Raj Thackeray booked for wielding sword during rally in Thane
278.article_body: A case has been registered against MNS chief Raj Thackeray, Thane MNS president Avinash Jadhav and party worker Ravindra More for allegedly wielding a sword during the political rally held in Thane on Tuesday. "We filed a case against the three under the Arms Act, Section 4 and Section 25 on Wednesday," an officer from Naupada Police said.

279.title: People who say Kashmir Files divides community should watch it first: Darshan
279.article_body: Darshan Kumaar, reacting to the claims that his film 'The Kashmir Files' was dividing communities, said, "I will request those people to first watch the film and then decide." Darshan stated he has been getting calls from his friends of "different religions" who cry and talk about his performance in it. "They said we brought the truth out," he added.

280.title: Rajinikanth is like a young child, ready to learn: Kushboo Sundar
280.article_body: Speaking about Rajinikanth, actress-politician Kushboo Sundar has said, "He comes across as a very young child, ready to learn...that's his biggest quality...that's what makes him a legend." She further stated working with Rajinikanth after 28 years in the 2021 Tamil film 'Annaatthe' was a "wonderful experience". "What I have seen and known him, he hasn't changed at all," Kushboo added.

281.title: Women's situation in WB similar to Draupadi's 'Cheer Haran': BJP MP
281.article_body: BJP's Roopa Ganguly on Wednesday compared situation of women in Bengal to Draupadi's 'Cheer Haran'. Ganguly, who portrayed Draupadi in 'Mahabharat', added that she felt pain of her character and feels same way for women subjected to atrocities in Bengal. Her comments come amid alleged rape of a 14-year-old girl in Nadia, wherein a TMC leader's son is reportedly involved.

282.title: Winless MI to bowl first against PBKS, Tymal Mills returns to MI's playing XI
282.article_body: MI captain Rohit Sharma won the toss and elected to bowl first against PBKS in their IPL 2022 clash on Wednesday. MI, who are yet to win a match in IPL 2022, have made one change to their playing XI, with Tymal Mills replacing Ramandeep Singh. PBKS, who are seventh on the points table, are playing with an unchanged side.

283.title: 'Picture abhi baaki hai mere dost': Tejasvi Surya after being detained
283.article_body: BJP Yuva Morcha National President Tejasvi Surya after being detained by Rajasthan Police when he tried to visit violence-hit Karauli tweeted, "Picture abhi baaki hai mere dost." Reacting to the step taken by police officials, the BJP MP said, "Section 144 is not in place at where we are now. This dictatorial government is snatching our rights."

284.title: Don't take lunch break for more than 30 mins: CM Yogi to UP officials
284.article_body: Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath has ordered his officials to reach office on time and not take lunch break for more than 30 minutes. He has also asked ministers and officials to stay at government guesthouses instead of hotels during official tours, an official said. They have been asked not to appoint relatives as their personal secretaries.

285.title: Video shows the moment cable cars collided on Jharkhand ropeway
285.article_body: A video shows the moment cable cars collided with each other at Trikut hills close to Baba Baidyanath Temple in Jharkhand's Deoghar district on Sunday. At least three people died and several others were injured due to the accident. The Indian Air Force had conducted a rescue mission at the site.

286.title: Can officially say that Ranbir, Alia make the best-looking pair: Remo
286.article_body: Filmmaker-choreographer Remo D'souza, who choreographed a part of the song 'Kesariya' in the film 'Brahmastra', said, "Ranbir Kapoor and Alia Bhatt have the best chemistry, both on and off-screen." "Now that they are getting married, I can officially say that they make the best-looking pair," he added. Remo further said that it was "beautiful" to shoot with Ranbir and Alia.

287.title: Security for victim's family in Asaram Bapu rape case stepped up
287.article_body: Police have stepped up security for the family of the victim in the 2013 rape case against Asaram Bapu after the victim's father claimed a threat to his family members' lives from Bapu's supporters. The victim's father alleged that a suspected follower of Bapu left a threat letter on March 21, adding that derogatory language was used.

288.title: World Bank slashes India's FY23 GDP forecast from 8.7% to 8%
288.article_body: The World Bank cut its FY23 GDP growth forecast for India from 8.7% to 8%. "High oil and food prices caused by the war in Ukraine will have a strong negative impact on people's real incomes," said World Bank South Asia VP Hartwig Schafer. World Bank has also slashed the growth forecast for South Asia, excluding Afghanistan, to 6.6%.

289.title: Draw of lots for DDA Special Housing Scheme 2021 on Apr 18: Officials
289.article_body: Draw of lots for Delhi Development Authority's (DDA) Special Housing Scheme 2021 is slated to be held on April 18, officials said on Wednesday. The scheme is offering 18,335 flats of different categories that remained "unsold in DDA's previous housing schemes". The draw "will be based on random number generation system" and will be streamed live.

290.title: 24-yr-old soldier records himself raping a baby, arrested in Russia
290.article_body: A 24-year-old Russian soldier, Alexei Bychkov, has been arrested in Russia for allegedly filming himself raping a baby. While it was not known exactly when and where the footage was filmed, some media reports claimed the incident took place in Ukraine. Bychkov also allegedly shared other videos of child abuse with his friends and colleagues.

291.title: Lawyer sent to 14-days judicial custody over protest at Pawar's Mumbai home
291.article_body: A Mumbai court sent advocate Gunaratna Sadavarte to 14-days of judicial custody in connection to the protest by MSRTC employees outside NCP chief Sharad Pawar's Mumbai residence last week. Satara Police will take Sadavarte into their custody tomorrow. Reportedly, his wife Jayashree Patil has also been named as an accused for allegedly instigating the protest.

292.title: Liquor hid inside LPG cylinder by cutting its base in Bihar seized; video viral
292.article_body: A video has gone viral on social media that showed liquor hidden inside an LPG cylinder by cutting the cylinder's base into a square shape in Bihar's Patna. A man was arrested for delivering liquor in an LPG cylinder near Kadam Ghat and police seized several litres of liquor. The sale and consumption of liquor are banned in Bihar.

293.title: 10 more children test positive for COVID-19 in Gautam Buddh Nagar
293.article_body: Ten more children tested COVID-19 positive in Gautam Buddh Nagar, taking the total number of minors infected in the district this week to nearly 23, officials said. "We have not got any information from their schools, neither were the COVID-19 tests held [there]," Chief Medical Officer said. On Monday, a school was shut after 13 students tested positive for COVID-19.

294.title: Finland to decide on NATO membership in coming weeks: PM Marin
294.article_body: Finland's PM Sanna Marin said on Wednesday that the country will decide whether it will join NATO in the coming weeks. Marin's comments came as she met her Swedish counterpart Magdalena Andersson in Stockholm to discuss regional security amid the Russian military offensive in Ukraine. Notably, Russia has warned both Finland and Sweden against joining the military alliance.

295.title: Bombay HC denies stay on 'Jersey', film to release on April 22
295.article_body: Bombay High Court has denied a stay on Shahid Kapoor's upcoming film 'Jersey' after the film's makers were accused of plagiarism by writer Rajneesh Jaiswal. Jaiswal had claimed that the movie's script belonged to him. 'Jersey' will be released on April 22. The film is a Hindi remake of the 2019 Telugu film 'Jersey' which starred actor Nani.

296.title: What is the case involving K'taka minister and a contractor's suicide?
296.article_body: Karnataka minister KS Eshwarappa is accused of abetting the suicide of a contractor Santhosh Patil. In letters to the Centre, Patil said he and six other contractors invested ₹4 crore for road projects in Belagavi in 2021 but suffered losses due to delay in payments. He accused Eshwarappa and his associates of demanding a 40% commission for clearing the bill.

297.title: Largest comet ever seen in space confirmed; NASA shares pics
297.article_body: NASA's Hubble Space Telescope has confirmed the largest comet nucleus ever seen, stating that the estimated diameter is approximately 80 miles across, making it larger than US' Rhode Island. The mass of comet C/2014 UN271 (Bernardinelli-Bernstein) is estimated to be 500 trillion tons. The previous record holder is comet C/2002 VQ94, with a nucleus estimated to be 60 miles across.

298.title: Nawab Malik's properties, including 5 flats in Mumbai, attached by ED
298.article_body: The Enforcement Directorate on Wednesday said it has attached eight properties linked to jailed Maharashtra minister Nawab Malik and his family in connection to a money laundering case involving Dawood Ibrahim. The attached properties include a unit at Kurla in Mumbai, a 147-acre agricultural land at Osmanabad in Maharashtra, three flats in Kurla and two residential flats in Bandra.

299.title: JMI students stage protest against violence at JNU over non-veg food
299.article_body: Students of Jamia Millia Islamia held a protest at the university's campus on Tuesday to protest against the violence that took place at Jawaharlal Nehru University allegedly over serving non-vegetarian food on Ram Navami. Around 50 students were present at the protest, which was organised by the Students Islamic Organisation of India (SIO), All India Students Association (AISA) and more.

300.title: Mira hugged me & cried for 15 mins after watching 'Jersey': Shahid
300.article_body: Shahid Kapoor has said that his wife Mira Rajput hugged him and cried for 15 minutes after watching his film 'Jersey'. "She was overwhelmed because I was playing a father in the film...After watching the film, Mira understood a lot about me as a person; she could understand my struggles," he stated. "Mira connected with the film deeply," he added.

301.title: Ambedkar Jayanti to be celebrated as 'Day of Equality' in TN: Stalin
301.article_body: Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin announced on Wednesday that the birth anniversary of BR Ambedkar on April 14 (Ambedkar Jayanti) will be celebrated as the 'Day of Equality' in the state. Stalin added that a full-sized bronze statue of Ambedkar will be erected in Chennai. Additionally, a few of Ambedkar's books will be published after being translated into Tamil.

302.title: We have no work with any Russian client today: Infosys
302.article_body: Infosys CEO Salil Parekh, while announcing Infosys Q4 results, said, "We have no work with any Russian client today and we have no plans for any work with any Russian client going ahead." He added, "The work we do is for a few of our global clients that have operations in Russia. We have less than 100 employees in Russia."

303.title: Infosys hired 85,000 freshers last year, to add over 50,000 freshers this year
303.article_body: Infosys CFO Nilanjan Roy said, "In the last year (FY22) we hired 85,000 freshers, both globally and in India." He added, "We are planning to do (hire) upwards of 50,000 freshers at least this year (FY23)...and we will see how that plays out...but that's just initial." He also said, "The good news is...we've mastered the art of off-campus recruitment."

304.title: Suspected canine virus kills all 7 foxes in Ranchi zoo in last 1 month
304.article_body: All seven foxes at Bhagwan Birsa Biological Park in Jharkhand's Ranchi died in last one month, its director Jabbar Singh said, adding that it may be due to canine virus. The first fox died in March first week. "Though we haven't...received any official report from IVRI, [it] verbally hinted that the deaths might be due to [canine virus]," he added.

305.title: Union Minister seeks action plan to rejuvenate B'luru's water bodies
305.article_body: Union Minister Rajeev Chandrasekhar has asked the Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike to submit an action plan on rejuvenating the city's existing water bodies. He visited the Kempambudhi, Gubbalala and Mestripalya lakes as part of the initiative to develop 75 'Amrit Sarovars', under which either old lakes will be improved or new ones will be created in each district of India.

306.title: Infosys' employee attrition rate rises to 27.7% in Q4
306.article_body: Infosys announced on Wednesday that its employee attrition rate continued to rise during the January-March 2022 quarter, reaching 27.7%. The attrition rate in Q3 FY22 was 25.5% and in Q4 FY21 was 10.9%. Infosys' employee count increased 20.95% YoY from 2,59,619 to 3,14,015 in Q4 FY22, with a majority of them being software professionals.

307.title: Over 1,000 Ukraine marine troops have surrendered in Mariupol: Russia
307.article_body: Russia's Defence Ministry said on Wednesday that 1,026 Ukrainian marine troops have surrendered in port city of Mariupol, which has been besieged by Russian troops for weeks. Among the surrendered troops were 162 officers and 47 women personnel, the ministry further said. Over 10,000 civilians have died in the city since the Russian invasion began, Mariupol's Mayor Vadym Boychenko said.

308.title: Imran Khan to be investigated over sale of gifted necklace for PKR 180 million
308.article_body: After being ousted from the PM's office, Imran Khan faces a central probe for allegedly selling a necklace received as a gift from another nation. Reports said it wasn't sent to the state repository as is custom. It was instead given to special assistant Zulfikar Bukhari, who then sold it to a jeweller, reportedly for PKR 180 million (₹7 crore).

309.title: Jhunjhunwala sells substantial stake in Indiabulls Real Estate
309.article_body: Billionaire investor Rakesh Jhunjhunwala has sold a substantial portion of his stake in Indiabulls Real Estate Limited. His name is missing from the company's key shareholder's list but the quantum of shares he has sold is not yet clear. According to Indiabulls' Q3 FY22 shareholding data, Jhunjhunwala held five million shares, or a 1.1% stake, in the real estate firm.

310.title: Infosys reports ₹32,276 cr revenue in Q4, net profit at ₹5,686 cr
310.article_body: Infosys reported a 22.67% YoY rise in revenue from operations from ₹26,311 crore to ₹32,276 crore and a 12.01% rise in net profit to ₹5,686 crore in Q4 FY22. Profit in Q3 FY22 was ₹5,809 crore and revenue was ₹31,867 crore. Infosys' financial services segment witnessed the highest revenue in Q4 at ₹10,096 crore, up 16.35% from ₹8,677 crore.

311.title: MI should have played him vs RCB: Sehwag backs Sams despite 35-run over
311.article_body: Ex-Team India opener Virender Sehwag said MI should have played Australian pacer Daniel Sams in their loss against RCB, despite conceding 35 runs in an over in the previous match against KKR. "MI needed him with the bat. When wickets were falling, Sams could have come and...taken MI to a respectable total," added Sehwag. MI will take on PBKS today.

312.title: Will not be indifferent to those who undermine Russia sanctions: US
312.article_body: The US and its allies "will not be indifferent" to those who undermine sanctions they've imposed on Russia over Ukraine war, US Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen said. Nations seeking advantage by failing to condemn Russia's "heinous war" are being short-sighted, she added. Until Russian President Vladimir Putin ends the war, the US will "work...to push Russia further towards...isolation", she said.

313.title: 7-yr-old Pune boy to have solo exhibition of his paintings in London
313.article_body: Seven-year-old Advait Kolarkar from Pune will have a solo exhibition of his paintings at the Gagliardi Gallery in London from May 12 to 22. "His canvas is covered with motifs such as oceans and dinosaurs," his mother said. His first exhibition was held in Art2Day Gallery, followed by City of Saint John Gallery in Canada and Artexpo New York, USA.

314.title: Won't take body till accused are arrested: Late K'taka contractor's family
314.article_body: Prashant Patil, the brother of contractor Santhosh Patil who allegedly died by suicide in Karnataka, has said the family won't take his body till those named in FIR aren't arrested. "Karnataka minister KS Eshwarappa, Basavaraj and Ramesh must be arrested...We want justice," he said. In a purported suicide note, Patil blamed Eshwarappa for his death and demanded punishment for him.

315.title: MacBook maker Quanta suspends ops at China plants amid COVID-19
315.article_body: Taiwan-based MacBook maker Quanta Computer is among the growing list of firms that have suspended operations at some Chinese plants amid the government's measures against COVID-19. Quanta suspended its operations at its Shanghai plant. It said it was in close touch with suppliers and assessing the financial impact. Over 30 firms have suspended their operations.

316.title: 5-yr-old girl raped by 22-yr-old neighbour in Faridabad; absconding
316.article_body: A 5-year-old girl was allegedly raped by her 22-year-old neighbour when she was alone at her home in Faridabad's Pali Crusher Zone, police said on Wednesday. According to the victim's father, the accused forcefully entered their house on Monday and raped her. An FIR has been registered against the accused, said Station House Officer (Dabua Police Station) Inspector Bhagwan.

317.title: India's trade deficit rises 35.7% YoY to $18.51 billion in March 2022
317.article_body: India's merchandise trade deficit in March 2022 rose 35.7% YoY from $13.64 billion to $18.51 billion. While merchandise exports rose 19.76% to $42.22 billion, its imports rose 24.21% to $60.74 billion, data released by the government showed. The overall trade deficit widened to $9.91 billion in March, up 93.93% YoY from $5.11 billion in March 2021.

318.title: Death of all US leaders wouldn't avenge Soleimani killing: Iranian commander
318.article_body: The killing of all American leaders will "still not avenge" Iran's Revolutionary Guards' (IRGC) top commander Qassem Soleimani's killing, a senior Iranian Guards commander Mohammad Pakpour said. "We should avenge him by following Soleimani's path and through other methods," he added. Soleimani was killed in an airstrike in 2020 ordered by then-US President Donald Trump at the Baghdad airport.

319.title: Shilpa Shetty's mother Sunanda granted bail in ₹21L loan default case
319.article_body: Shilpa Shetty's mother Sunanda Shetty has been granted bail on Tuesday in a ₹21 lakh loan default and cheating case. The bailable warrant, which was issued against Sunanda last month, was cancelled by a city court. The complainant had claimed that the loan, reportedly taken by Shilpa's late father in 2015, was to be repaid by January 2017.

320.title: MI need to be ultra-aggressive like CSK to win their 1st game: Graeme Swann
320.article_body: Ahead of MI's game against PBKS, ex-England cricketer Graeme Swann has said the Rohit Sharma-led side needs to be "ultra-aggressive" like CSK was against RCB to register their first win of the IPL season. "MI basically need to take a template from what CSK did...and copy that going forward," he stated. So far, MI are winless in their four games.

321.title: Man booked for making indecent remarks against UP CM Yogi Adityanath
321.article_body: Police have booked a man in UP's Budaun for allegedly making indecent remarks against CM Yogi Adityanath. According to SSP OP Singh, a video had surfaced on social media wherein the man, identified as Mahendra, can be seen making indecent remarks against the CM. An FIR was lodged in this regard based on BJP office-bearer Anuj Saxena's complaint.

322.title: US space firm shares lounge capsule design to be lifted via giant balloon
322.article_body: US-based Space Perspective has shared its design for a tourist lounge capsule that comes with 360-degree panoramic windows and will rise to the edge of space. It shared the interior of Spaceship Neptune, a pressurised capsule that will cruise high above Earth, lifted via a giant balloon. The lounge will have mood lighting, reclining chairs and plants, among other things.

323.title: Johnny Depp's sister testifies in court, says 'Amber called him old, fat man'
323.article_body: Johnny Depp's sister Christi Dembrowski testified in the defamation lawsuit filed by Johnny against his ex-wife Amber Heard. "I've seen...insults, multiple times actually. Amber called Johnny an 'old, fat man'," Christi testified. She recalled Amber being in "disbelief" when Dior wanted to work with Johnny. She stated, "Amber said, 'Dior is about class and style...you [Johnny] don't have style'."

324.title: T20 cricket heading towards where football is, already we're late: Ashwin on retiring out
324.article_body: Referring to himself retiring out against LSG, RR's Ravichandran Ashwin said, "T20, as a sport, is heading towards where football has reached. Just like how they're using substitutions, I did something similar [retiring out]." He added, "Already we're late, but I believe this will happen a lot in the coming days." He further said it was a tactical decision.

325.title: Villagers came in tractors to see 'Big B's son' during Refugee's shoot: Abhishek
325.article_body: Actor Abhishek recalled that several villagers had heard reports of Amitabh Bachchan's son filming and had come to the sets of 'Refugee' in Bhuj, Gujarat, to watch him. "People from...villages came filled in tractors," he said. "Then I started thinking 'Oh they've all come to see Mr Bachchan's son and I'm going to be such an epic failure'," he added.

326.title: US lying about possible chemical attack in Ukraine: Russia
326.article_body: Russia has said that US is spreading lies about a possible chemical attack in Ukraine. "We call on Washington to stop spreading disinformation," said Russian embassy in US. Russia claimed that it had destroyed the last of its chemical weapons in 2017. Meanwhile, Ukraine has said it was looking into the possible use of chemical weapons in Mariupol.

327.title: 13 dead after consuming poisonous mushrooms in Assam
327.article_body: As many as 13 people, including a minor, died across four districts in Assam within a week, allegedly after consuming poisonous mushrooms. All the victims were undergoing treatment at  Assam Medical College and Hospital in Dibrugarh, an official said. "Most of them are from tea garden areas. Many people from...Upper Assam...fall ill after eating poisonous mushrooms every year," he added.

328.title: 'Signal Free Corridor' to make commute to B'luru Airport swifter
328.article_body: The Karnataka government is planning to redevelop the road leading to Bengaluru Airport into a 'Signal Free Corridor', with railway gates and villages nearby, as well as elevating the roads, bridges and underpasses. Around 154 km of Bengaluru will be revamped, which will reduce traffic congestion by at least 20% in the city, reports said.

329.title: US-based Halozyme to buy Antares Pharma in $960 mn all-cash deal
329.article_body: US-based Halozyme Therapeutics will buy specialty pharmaceutical firm Antares Pharma in a $960 million all-cash deal, the companies said on Wednesday. Halozyme will pay $5.6 for each share of Antares Pharma, a premium of 49.7% to the company's last closing price. "The addition of Antares...further strengthens our position as a leading drug delivery company," Halozyme CEO Helen Torley said.

330.title: Google CEO Pichai to co-chair council to help Ukrainian refugees settle in US
330.article_body: Google and Alphabet CEO Sundar Pichai will co-chair a new CEO council with over 30 CEOs to help Ukrainians and Afghans resettle in the US. "It builds on Google's long-standing support for immigrants, dreamers and refugees, and will help people through access to technology, jobs and more," Pichai said. The Welcome.US CEO council is co-chaired by Accenture CEO Julie Sweet.

331.title: BJP's Tejasvi Surya, others detained on way to Rajasthan's Karauli
331.article_body: BJP Yuva Morcha chief and MP Tejasvi Surya was on Wednesday detained by Rajasthan Police at Hindaun-Mahwa border as he tried to visit violence-hit Karauli along with others. "Section 144 is not in place at where we are now...It's our constitutional right to go to Karauli," he said. Earlier today, he met victims of the violence at a Jaipur hospital.

332.title: 'Made in India' COVID-19 vaccines better than Pfizer, Moderna: Adar Poonawalla
332.article_body: Covishield maker Serum Institute of India's CEO Adar Poonawalla claimed that "Made in India" COVID-19 vaccines have provided better protection than mRNA vaccines like Pfizer and Moderna. "It's good that...vaccines like...Pfizer and Moderna aren't introduced in India," he said. "In countries like the US, people have taken 2nd and 3rd booster dose and still many are getting infected," he added.

333.title: Played dholak at Rishi, Neetu's wedding; RK weddings have best food: Subhash
333.article_body: Filmmaker Subhash Ghai recalled playing the dholak (hand drum) at the wedding of actor-couple Rishi Kapoor and Neetu Kapoor in 1980. He said, "Chintu (Rishi) and Neetu got married in 'RK' style." "Raj Kapoor...used to treat the film industry as a family. The Kapoors are very warm people. RK weddings have the best of food, drinks and music," he added.

334.title: Don’t need to be taught what Hindutva is, it’s in Shiv Sena's blood: Sanjay Raut
334.article_body: Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut said that his party does not need to be taught what Hindutva is. "It (Hindutva) is in Shiv Sena's blood. Whenever Hindutva was attacked, at that time, it was not the BJP that came to the forefront. It was us, Balasaheb Thackeray and Uddhav Thackeray," Raut added.

335.title: Request PM to immediately withdraw 'Achhe Din': Kharge on rising inflation
335.article_body: Congress leader Mallikarjun Kharge said that inflation was at its highest in the last 17 months and asked PM Narendra Modi to withdraw his "Achhe Din" statement. Taking to Twitter, he said, "At 7%, inflation is now highest in 17 months. I humbly request PM to immediately withdraw these 'Achhe Din'. People of India have had enough of 'good times'."

336.title: BJP should change its name to Modi-Shah party: Congress’ Kuldeep Rathore
336.article_body: Himachal Pradesh Congress chief Kuldeep Singh Rathore said BJP has become a party of two people and it should change its name to "Modi-Shah party". His remark came in reaction to BJP chief JP Nadda’s "Congress is neither Indian nor national" comment. "He should know the history of Congress before making such a remark," Rathore added.

337.title: Halting debt payments will pressurise Sri Lanka's banking sector: Ex-PM
337.article_body: Ex-Sri Lankan PM Ranil Wickremesinghe has said that the government's move to temporarily halt foreign debt payments will put additional pressure on country's banking sector amid ongoing economic crisis. He added that the new finance minister should discuss the prevailing situation with International Monetary Fund. Sri Lanka declared on Tuesday that it'll default on its $51 billion external debt.

338.title: Baby monkey hugging dead mother rescued by TN volunteers; IAS officer shares footage
338.article_body: IAS officer Supriya Sahu has shared a video of a baby monkey being fed milk after it was rescued by volunteers at the Besant Memorial Animal Dispensary in Tamil Nadu. "Kudos to volunteers at the Besant Memorial Animal Dispensary for saving this baby monkey who was found hugging her dead mother. Thank you for your service," Sahu tweeted.

339.title: I'm happy Ranbir is getting married; will decide reception details today: Randhir
339.article_body: Speaking about Ranbir Kapoor and Alia Bhatt's wedding, the former's uncle, veteran actor Randhir Kapoor, said, "Ranbir is going to get married but not today. It's around...April 15. I'm...happy [for him]." When asked if there will be a reception, Randhir said, "I'm on my way back (to Mumbai). I was in Goa...So we'll discuss that today and decide."

340.title: Dube got nearly impossible elevation in 102-metre six vs RCB: Manjrekar
340.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Sanjay Manjrekar said CSK all-rounder Shivam Dube has a natural gift of hitting the ball a long way like Yuvraj Singh. "Josh Hazlewood got it right, bowled it full...Dube was deep inside the crease and to get that kind of elevation, it's almost impossible," added Manjrekar while discussing the all-rounder's 102-metre maximum in the 20th over.

341.title: 5-yr-old tribal girl kidnapped, murdered in Gujarat's Surat, 1 arrested
341.article_body: One person was arrested after a 5-year-old tribal girl was kidnapped and murdered in Punagam area of Surat, Gujarat on Wednesday. According to police, the accused took away the girl while she was asleep. His intention was to commit rape, however, the girl raised an alarm, following which he killed her on the spot, police added.

342.title: SC seeks status report in Haridwar hate speech case from state govt
342.article_body: The Supreme Court has sought a status report from Uttarakhand government regarding the progress in the investigation into the Haridwar hate speech case. During the hearing, counsel appearing for the Uttarakhand government told the apex court that the police registered four FIRs and in three of them, charge sheets have been filed.

343.title: Woman gives birth under mobile phone light in Haryana due to power cut
343.article_body: Following a power cut, a woman had to give birth under the light of mobile phones at a community health centre in Haryana's Alewa on Tuesday. She was taken to the health centre on Monday night as she was in labour, her mother-in-law said. Power failure at the facility causes lot of problems, said the health centre in-charge, Dr Vinod.

344.title: It's between me and my family: Quinton De Kock on decision to quit Test cricket
344.article_body: Opening up on his decision to announce retirement from Tests aged 29, South Africa wicketkeeper-batter Quinton De Kock said, "My reasoning is kept to myself. It's between me and my family." He added, "Obviously, it was a shock to everyone. But I made my decision...It is what it is. Doesn't take away the fact that I still love the game."

345.title: Delhi Transport Minister flags off 80 AC low-floor CNG buses
345.article_body: Delhi Transport Minister Kailash Gahlot on Wednesday flagged off 80 new air-conditioned low-floor CNG buses from Rajghat depot. "Under the guidance of CM Arvind Kejriwal we're committed to making Delhi's public transport service strong," Gahlot tweeted. These buses also have an Intelligent Transport System (ITS) through which all these buses can be monitored on a real-time basis, officials said.

346.title: Willing to talk to protesters: Sri Lankan PM amid economic crisis
346.article_body: Sri Lankan PM Mahinda Rajapaksa said he's "willing to talk to" the protesters occupying the entrance to the President's office and listen to their ideas for resolving the ongoing economic and political crisis. The protesters camped out for a fifth day demanding the resignation of PM's brother, President Gotabaya Rajapaksa, blaming him for the country's worst economic situation in decades.

347.title: Urvashi to make her H'wood debut with 365 Days actor Michele Morrone: Reports
347.article_body: Actress Urvashi Rautela is all set to make her Hollywood Debut with '365 Days' actor Michele Morrone. According to reports, Urvashi will be seen as a lead in the movie. The working title for the film is 'Renata Fonte', which will be produced by Netflix, Tomasz Mandes and will be directed by '365 Days' director Barbara Bialowas, reports added.

348.title: COVID-19 vaccination centres to be shut in Mumbai on April 14
348.article_body: All government-run COVID-19 vaccination centres will be closed on Thursday, April 14, in Mumbai, the Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) has said. The vaccination will resume on Friday,  April 15. Meanwhile, on Tuesday, Mumbai reported 52 new COVID-19 cases and no deaths. Only one patient was hospitalised yesterday and the recovery rate in Mumbai stands at 98%.

349.title: Google to invest $9.5 billion in US offices, data centres in 2022
349.article_body: Google has announced that it will invest $9.5 billion in US offices and data centres over 2022, up from $7 billion last year. It's expected to create 12,000 new jobs by 2022-end. Google will open a new office in Atlanta. "It might seem counterintuitive to step up our investment in physical offices even as we embrace more flexibility," Google said.

350.title: No funeral till minister is arrested: K'taka contractor's family
350.article_body: The family of the Karnataka contractor Santosh Patil, who allegedly killed himself on Tuesday, has demanded arrest of all the accused in the case, including Karnataka minister KS Eshwarappa.
