"Everybody whose names are mentioned in the FIR must be arrested. We want justice for our brother," said Patil's brother. "We won't conduct the funeral till Eshwarappa is arrested," he added.

351.title: AIMIM leader Akbaruddin Owaisi acquitted in 2 hate speech cases
351.article_body: A Hyderabad court on Wednesday acquitted All India Majlis-E-Ittehadul Muslimeen (AIMIM) leader Akbaruddin Owaisi in two hate speech cases registered against him. The prosecution failed to produce proper evidence for the same, the court said. It directed Akbaruddin not to make any controversial speeches in future. He had made the alleged hate speeches in Nirmal and Nizamabad in 2012.

352.title: My 1st IPL wicket is one of my favourite batters, I'm happy: CSK's Theekshana
352.article_body: CSK's 21-year-old spinner Maheesh Theekshana picked four wickets while conceding 33 runs in his four overs against RCB. Talking about the match, Theekshana said, "My first IPL wicket is of one of my favourite batters [Faf du Plessis]...I'm really happy." Apart from RCB captain Plessis, Theekshana dismissed Anuj Rawat, Shahbaz Ahmed and Suyash Prabhudessai in the game.

353.title: Russian soldiers gangrape 11-yr-old boy; tied up mother forced to watch in Ukraine
353.article_body: Ukrainian officials have said that Russian soldiers allegedly gangraped an 11-year-old boy and tied up his mother to a chair, forcing her to watch. Ukraine's Parliamentary Commissioner for Human Rights Lyudmila Denisova said the boy was raped in Ukrainian town of Bucha, where several dead civilians showed signs of torture after it was recaptured.

354.title: Heart inflammation after taking COVID-19 vaccination rare: Lancet study
354.article_body: The overall risk of developing myopericarditis (inflammation of the heart muscle) after taking COVID-19 vaccination is very low, a Lancet study has found. The risk of developing the condition was higher for people who received mRNA vaccines with 22.6 cases per million doses than for those who took non-mRNA vaccines with 7.9 cases per million doses, the researchers said.

355.title: Want to correct public perception that JNU is 'tukde-tukde': VC
355.article_body: The Jawaharlal Nehru University Vice-Chancellor, Professor Santishree Dhulipudi Pandit, on Wednesday said people have a misconception about the university. "I want to correct the public perception that we are tukde-tukde...after I have taken over I've not seen anybody talking like that," she added. She further said that JNU is as nationalistic as anybody else.

356.title: True words: Zelenskyy after Biden calls Russia's invasion 'genocide'
356.article_body: Reacting to US President Joe Biden labelling Russia's invasion of Ukraine a "genocide", Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said they were "true words of a true leader". "Calling things by their names is essential to stand up to evil," Zelenskyy added. "We're grateful for US assistance provided so far and we urgently need more heavy weapons to prevent...Russian atrocities," he said.

357.title: Oil India's production and drilling unaffected after cyber attack
357.article_body: Oil India Limited (OIL) PRO Tridiv Hazarika said the company's exploration and production work have not been affected in the suspected cyber attack in its field headquarters in Assam's Duliajan. The software handling functions like contractor and vendor payments is also functioning normally. OIL's Duliajan office had witnessed a cyber attack on Sunday which affected a few systems and servers.

358.title: Metro helped passengers save 269 million hrs of travel time in 2021: DMRC
358.article_body: Passengers cumulatively saved a "mammoth 269 million hours of travel time" in 2021 by using Delhi Metro services, the DMRC said on Tuesday. The Delhi Metro also helped "remove over five lakh vehicles from the streets of the national capital daily in 2021. This figure has also increased from about 4.74 lakh in 2019", the statement said.

359.title: TV actress Nikki Sharma deletes all social media posts, writes 'I tried but I am tired'
359.article_body: TV actress Nikki Sharma, who has been a part of shows including 'Sasural Simar Ka' and 'Brahmarakshas 2', recently deleted all her social media posts. She also shared a note on Instagram Stories which read, "I tried but I am tired, I want to be free from my own thoughts now." The actress has reportedly been depressed for some time.

360.title: Video of MS Dhoni plotting Virat Kohli's wicket goes viral
360.article_body: A video of CSK wicketkeeper MS Dhoni plotting RCB batter Virat Kohli's dismissal has gone viral. In the video, Dhoni can be seen moving Shivam Dube from fine leg to deep square leg for Kohli in RCB's fifth over bowled by Mukesh Choudhary. On the next ball, Kohli hit the ball towards deep square leg and was caught by Dube.

361.title: Matter of concern: Chirag on bomb explosion near CM Nitish's 'Jansabha' site
361.article_body: Reacting to the bomb explosion incident near Bihar CM Nitish Kumar's 'Jansabha' in Nalanda district, LJP supremo Chirag Paswan said, "It's a matter of concern and I condemn it." "There is repeated negligence, investigation should be done into the matter. This is the second attack on him within a month," he added. Earlier, a man attacked Nitish Kumar in Bakhtiyarpur.

362.title: Pic shows Hyd policeman giving food to elderly woman lying unconscious on road
362.article_body: A police official of the Hyderabad City Police offered food and water to an elderly woman who was lying unconscious on a road near the Sea World hotel lane. The police also shared a picture that shows the policeman offering idlis to the woman. Police said they had received a complaint that one woman was lying there.

363.title: Won't resign: K'taka minister named in contractor suicide case
363.article_body: Karnataka minister KS Eshwarappa, who was named in an FIR after 40-year-old contractor Santhosh Patil died by alleged suicide, said on Wednesday that there's no question of him resigning. In a suicide note, Patil had purportedly blamed Eshwarappa for his step. "The death note is false propaganda," Eshwarappa claimed, adding that he "has seen 100 cases like this".

364.title: Heatwave spell across northwest India ends, Delhi to witness winds: IMD
364.article_body: According to the India Meteorological Department (IMD), the major spell of heatwave across northwest India has come to an end. "Due to the increased presence of clouds over Delhi, Punjab, Rajasthan and Haryana, the temperature will decrease by 2-3°C...Delhi will have wind and cloud conditions," an IMD official said. "Heatwave conditions might arise in Rajasthan around April 16," he added.

365.title: Dolphin attacks trainer forcing it to perform in US; PETA shares video
365.article_body: PETA shared a video of a dolphin attacking a trainer after being allegedly forced to perform tricks for the visitors' entertainment at Miami Seaquarium. "This chilling video shows a dolphin attacking a trainer, tossing her body violently through the water, & reportedly sending her to the hospital," tweeted PETA. "Miami Seaquarium must send the animals to seaside sanctuaries," PETA added.

366.title: We gave dharna in Delhi but anti-farmer Centre didn't pay heed: TRS MLC
366.article_body: Telangana produces 40% of India's rice, TRS MLC K Kalvakuntla said on Wednesday. "That's why we're called the rice bowl of India," Kalvakuntla added. "Since production is so high, we require help from the Central government. We gave dharna in Delhi but the corporate-friendly and anti-farmer Central government didn't pay heed to it," Kalvakuntla stated.

367.title: Sri Lanka urges citizens living abroad to send money amid economic crisis
367.article_body: Sri Lanka has urged its citizens living abroad to donate money amid the economic crisis the country is going through. Central bank Governor Nandalal Weerasinghe asked them to "support the country at this crucial juncture". He said the bank "assures that such foreign currency transfers will be utilised only for importation of essentials, including food, fuel and medicines".

368.title: Superiority of son over father; it's a dream of every dad: Big B on Abhishek
368.article_body: Amitabh Bachchan praised his son, actor Abhishek Bachchan, post the release of his film 'Dasvi'. He said Abhishek has given him "so much pride and joy". Sharing an article on Instagram featuring Abhishek, Amitabh wrote, "Every father's dream...My prayers [are always] with you." He also took to his blog and wrote, "The superiority of...son over the father...Biggest moment of pride."

369.title: Prashanth's concern was my health after cancer, mine was 'Adheera': Sanjay
369.article_body: Sanjay Dutt said he was concerned only about his character 'Adheera' in upcoming film 'K.G.F: Chapter 2', after making a comeback having been diagnosed with cancer during the movie's production. Sanjay added that the film's director Prashanth Neel was concerned about his health. "While the journey has been challenging, I have loved every part of it," stated Sanjay.

370.title: Deutsche Telekom buys $2.4 billion SoftBank stake in T-Mobile
370.article_body: Deutsche Telekom AG has bought SoftBank Group's stake in T-Mobile US for $2.4 billion. It now holds 48.4% of the company. Deutsche Telekom bought 21.2 million shares at an average price of $113 per T-Mobile share. In September last year, SoftBank agreed to swap about 45 million T-Mobile shares for a 4.5% stake in Deutsche Telekom AG.

371.title: 7 sentenced to life over toddler’s kidnapping in 2014 in Mumbai
371.article_body: A sessions court in Mumbai sentenced seven people to life imprisonment for kidnapping a three-year-old boy and taking a ransom of ₹81 lakh from his father in 2014. They were only arrested a year later for kidnapping a 21-year-old and demanding ₹2 crore ransom. Court held the accused guilty of kidnapping for ransom, extortion, wrongful confinement and criminal conspiracy.

372.title: PMRDA files complaints against 6 builders for selling illegal plots
372.article_body: Pune Metropolitan Region Development Authority (PMRDA) has filed police complaints against six builders for selling illegal plots to people. "Before purchasing...plots in the PMRDA region, citizens must check the legalities instead of blocking their money," an official said. PMRDA also appealed to residents to reach out to the authority if they have information on illegal plotting in the region.

373.title: 3 members of family shot at over pet dog's bark in UP's Ghaziabad
373.article_body: Three members of a family were shot at by a group of men after the victims' pet dog barked at them in UP's Ghaziabad, police said. "All victims suffered gunshot injuries...[were] rushed to Delhi's GTB Hospital," police added. "On Monday night, the dog barked at the suspects again...in a fit of rage, they brought firearms...shot at the victims," police stated.

374.title: 19-yr-old girl caught with pistol in her pocket; video shows UP police recovering it
374.article_body: A 19-year-old girl was caught with a country-made pistol in Uttar Pradesh's Mainpuri. A video of the incident is being widely circulated online, showing a policewoman recovering the weapon from her pocket. While several reports claimed that the accused was a teacher, Mainpuri Police clarified that she is not a teacher and the case is under investigation.

375.title: Akash Deep will be the trump card for RCB at the backend of IPL 2022: Hogg
375.article_body: Ex-Australia spinner Brad Hogg has said RCB pacer Akash Deep will be the franchise's trump card with the ball at the backend of the ongoing IPL season. "Akash, with his extra height and bounce, is going to improve...I like the way he swings the ball away from the left-handers...He'll be the final tick in the box for RCB," added Hogg.

376.title: Journalist arrested in Pune over protests outside Sharad Pawar's home
376.article_body: A journalist has been arrested from Pune in connection with the protest by MSRTC employees outside NCP chief Sharad Pawar's home in Mumbai. A group of MSRTC employees had staged a protest outside Pawar's residence on April 8, accusing him of not doing anything to help them. At least 115 people have been arrested in the matter so far.

377.title: Will not allow imposition of Hindi in Tamil Nadu: BJP's Annamalai
377.article_body: Days after Amit Shah's Hindi speaking remark, Tamil Nadu BJP leader K Annamalai said that the state unit of the party will not allow the imposition of Hindi in the state. "If we require for work, education or other purposes, we can learn Hindi but it cannot be imposed. None of us here, including me, speaks Hindi," Annamalai said.

378.title: Asking senior actors to audition is humiliating, really hurts: Sudhaa Chandran
378.article_body: Actress Sudhaa Chandran said asking senior actors like her to audition is humiliating and really hurts, adding that she openly refuses to audition. "If I have to audition then what is my 35 years of input in this industry, and if you don't know my calibre, well I don't want to work with you," stated Sudhaa.

379.title: There's so much fear: Suchitra on her mother comparing actors to prostitutes
379.article_body: Discussing her novel 'Drama Queen' where she mentioned how her mother was against her acting in films and going on to compare actors to prostitutes, Suchitra Krishnamoorthi said there's so much fear about the sexuality, confidence of girls. Suchitra further discussed in the book about her sister being criticised for standing at a bus stop as "only prostitutes loiter there".

380.title: 'Runway 34' shot with 14-15 cameras which nobody in B'wood has done: Ajay
380.article_body: Discussing his upcoming film 'Runway 34', actor Ajay Devgn said the movie had scenes which were shot using 14 to 15 cameras which nobody in Bollywood has done before. "It was pretty tough to shoot. The first decision we took was to make a genuine...cockpit. The size of a cockpit is small. Two people barely fit in," added Ajay.

381.title: Went to 'Donda' premiere having not spoken to Kanye for 8 months: Kim
381.article_body: Talking about her former husband and rapper Kanye West, Kim Kardashian said she attended the premiere of Kanye's album 'Donda', having earlier not spoken to him for eight months at the beginning of their divorce. Kim filed for divorce from Kanye in February 2021. Kanye is reportedly looking for "behavioural treatment" to "be a better human".

382.title: 60 kg fake gold seized in Assam; 1 arrested
382.article_body: Assam Police said they seized 60 kg fake gold from a person driving a four-wheeler vehicle during a security check at NH 15 on Tuesday. The police chased the vehicle and arrested the driver who tried to escape. "The police team chased the vehicle…During the search, we recovered 60 kg of fake gold from the vehicle," said police.

383.title: Anjuman-I-Islam members offer pooja at Dharwad's Hanumantha temple
383.article_body: Members of the educational and social organisation, Anjuman-I-Islam, offered a special pooja at the Sri Nuggikeri Hanumantha temple in Dharwad on Monday. This came after the members of Sri Ram Sene allegedly vandalised at least four fruit carts belonging to Muslim vendors near the temple on Saturday. Karnataka Police have made four arrests in the case so far.

384.title: Johnny Depp smiles as ex-wife's lawyer tells court 'Depp is obsessed with Musk'
384.article_body: Actor Johnny Depp smirked in the court as his ex-wife Amber Heard's lawyer said, "You'll find out that Depp is obsessed with Elon Musk." Actress Amber Heard, who filed for divorce with Depp in 2016, later dated Elon Musk. Depp sued Heard for defamation over her article on domestic violence, claiming that it implied Depp was an "abuser".

385.title: 17 Eklavya schools to be functional in Tripura by 2023-24: Union Minister
385.article_body: Union Minister Bishweswar Tudu on Tuesday said altogether 17 Eklavya Model Residential Schools would be made functional in Tripura by 2023-24 academic session. The state currently has four such educational institutes. "PM Narendra Modi has been laying emphasis on proper education for tribal youths as he believes only better learning can bring a change among them," Tudu added.

386.title: 1 killed as drunk driver rams car into pedestrians in Mumbai
386.article_body: A drunk driver, identified as Mukesh Pradeep Singh, rammed his car into pedestrians near the World Trade Centre in Mumbai's Cuffe Parade on Tuesday afternoon, allegedly killing one senior clerk working with the Navi Mumbai Police Commissionerate. After dropping off his employer, the accused took the car for a joyride, said police. He was arrested soon after the incident.

387.title: Over 42,000 displaced after tropical typhoon hits Philippines
387.article_body: More than 42,000 people have been displaced after Typhoon Megi made landfall on Sunday in the Philippines. Typhoon Megi had triggered landslides in coastal provinces, leaving at least 56 people dead and dozens of others missing. Notably, Megi is the first tropical cyclone to hit the country this year, which sees an average of 20 such storms annually.

388.title: Rohit must forget captaincy when he bats, needs to know he's 'Hitman': Sehwag
388.article_body: Ahead of MI's game against PBKS on Wednesday, ex-India opener Virender Sehwag said MI will have to "put extra runs on board" as CSK did against RCB to earn their first win in the ongoing IPL season. "Rohit Sharma will need to forget [captaincy] when he walks out to bat and needs to know that he's the 'Hitman'," added Sehwag.

389.title: Dharavi has recorded no new COVID-19 cases since Mar 24: BMC data
389.article_body: Asia's largest slum Dharavi has recorded no new COVID-19 cases since March 24, data collated by the Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) showed. With a population of 8.5 lakh residents, Dharavi has recorded 8,652 cases and 419 deaths due to COVID-19 since April 1, 2020. The G/North ward, which covers Dharavi, Dadar and Mahim areas, currently has only one active case.

390.title: Actions by state govts amid incidents of violence 'inappropriate': Mayawati
390.article_body: BSP chief Mayawati on Wednesday said state governments' actions in Madhya Pradesh, Gujarat and Rajasthan amid recent cases of violence were 'inappropriate'. Mayawati tweeted that the incidents disturbed peace and harmony, adding, "The actions initiated by (the state) governments prima facie seem to be revengeful." "Will such examples lead to a new India?" she further wrote.

391.title: Do it like the rich do: dezerv.
391.article_body: Wealthtech firm dezerv. claims to help you invest like the ultra-wealthy have been investing for decades. Their experts aim to curate high-performing portfolios to maximize your wealth. dezerv. also offers its members exclusive access to benefits like pre-IPO deals and plans to offer global equity deals soon. It’s time to use the strategies of the ultra-wealthy for yourself, said dezerv.

392.title: I refused to remove my turban: Minister Puri as he shares 2010 US airport incident
392.article_body: On the occasion of International Turban Day or Sikh Dastar Diwas on Wednesday, Union Minister Hardeep Singh Puri recalled an old incident at a US airport. "I refused to remove my Dastar (turban) or let anyone touch it at a US airport in 2010 leading to the current practice of self-pat check by Sikhs at international airports," he tweeted.

393.title: PMC begins sealing illegal structures during anti-encroachment drives
393.article_body: Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) has begun sealing illegal structures as it continues conducting anti-encroachment drives in city, PMC's anti-encroachment department head Madhav Jagtap said. "Every day...[anti-encroachment] drive goes on at five to six...locations in different ward offices," he added. Jagtap also appealed to residents to remove encroachments themselves instead of awaiting action.

394.title: Major fire breaks out at BSNL office in Pune, doused in nearly 2 hrs
394.article_body: A major fire broke out on the eight floor of the BSNL office in Pune Cantonment area around 1 am on Tuesday. Tables, chairs, sofas and computers were gutted in the blaze, an official said, adding that firemen had to break open glass window panes to get inside the building. The blaze was doused by 2.30 am.

395.title: Police warn media not to block cars as guests arrive for Ranbir-Alia's mehendi
395.article_body: Mumbai Police officials were seen issuing strict instructions to photographers not to block the cars for photos as guests arrived for Ranbir Kapoor and Alia Bhatt's mehendi ceremony, reported Times of India. They were asked to wait for whichever star wanted to give them a photo. Ayan Mukerji, Kareena Kapoor and Karisma Kapoor were seen arriving for the ceremony.

396.title: 2 drunk policemen breach IPL bio-bubble to click pictures with players
396.article_body: Two police constables, deputed for security at the DY Patil Stadium, breached the bio-bubble to click pictures with players during the IPL 2022 match between Gujarat Titans and SunRisers Hyderabad. The duo sneaked into the bio-bubble after arguing with the women constables. Both of them have been booked under section 85(1) of Maharashtra Prohibition Act.

397.title: Bharti documents baby's homecoming in a new video; reveals nickname
397.article_body: Comedian Bharti Singh, who welcomed a son with her husband Haarsh Limbachiyaa on April 3, shared a new video about the baby on their YouTube channel Lol (Life of Limbachiyaa's). She also shared a glimpse of the baby's welcome to their home and revealed the nickname she and Haarsh gave him. She said, "We call him Golla because he's golu-molu."

398.title: Mumbai-Ahmedabad Bullet Train project to start operations by 2027
398.article_body: National High Speed Rail Corporation Managing Director Satish Agnihotri said services for the public on the Mumbai-Ahmedabad High Speed Rail corridor will be rolled out in 2027. However, the trial run on the corridor's Gujarat section will begin in 2026. He said the Surat station, which will be one of the largest bullet train stations, will be completed by 2023.

399.title: Viral video shows ground suddenly collapsing with 5 men and a bike falling inside
399.article_body: A video has gone viral on social media showing the ground suddenly collapsing with five men and a bike falling inside. The incident purportedly happened at a roadside mechanic shop in Rajasthan. Four of the five men were talking to each other, while a mechanic was repairing the bike when the ground suddenly caved in.

400.title: 'Secret weapon' Hasaranga not bowling till 11th over blunder by RCB: Hogg
400.article_body: Discussing RCB's defeat against CSK, ex-KKR spinner Brad Hogg tweeted that RCB made a mistake by not making their "secret weapon" Wanindu Hasaranga bowl his first over till the 11th over. "CSK [were] tactically superior. They bowled seven overs of spin in the first 10 overs compared to three from RCB," added Hogg in his tweet.

401.title: What an incredible answer: Paytm CEO on MEA Jaishankar's remark on Russia
401.article_body: Paytm CEO Vijay Shekhar Sharma took to Twitter to laud the MEA S Jaishankar for his response to a reporter, who had asked, "Why not condemn Russia's invasion (of Ukraine)?" Jaishankar responded, "I prefer to do it my way and articulate it my way...We've made statements...We're against the conflict." Sharing Jaishankar's response, the Paytm CEO tweeted, "What an incredible answer."
